original: Ajitasenavyākaraṇam
analyzed: ajitasena vyākaraṇam

analyzed: om namaḥ sarvajñāya
translated: Om, homage to the Omniscient One!

original: evaṃ mayā śrutamekasmin samaye bhagavān śrāvastyāṃ viharati sma jetavane anāthapiṇḍadasyārāme mahātā bhikṣusaṅghena sārdhamardhatrayodaśabhirbhikṣusahasraiḥ
analyzed: evam mayā śrutam ekasmin samaye bhagavān śrāvastyām viharati sma jetavane anāthapiṇḍadasya ārāme mahātā bhikṣu saṅghena sārdham ardha trayodaśabhiḥ bhikṣu sahasraiḥ
translated: Thus have I heard. At one time the Blessed One was dwelling in Shravasti, in the Jeta Grove, in the garden of Anathapindada, together with a great assembly of 1,250 monks,

analyzed: tat yathā āyuṣmatā ca ajñātakauṇḍinyena āyuṣmatā ca mahānāmnā āyuṣmatā ca revatena āyuṣmatā

analyzed: ca vakkulena āyuṣmatā ca śāriputreṇa āyuṣmatā ca pūrṇena maitrāyaṇīputreṇa ca śrāvaka niyutaiḥ
translated: the Venerable Vakkula, the Venerable Shariputra, the Venerable Purnashira, the son of Maitrayani, and with many thousands of disciples.

original: te sarve yena bhagavān yena ca jetavanaṃ vihāraṃ tenopasaṅkrāntā bhagavataḥ pādau śirasābhivandya bhagavataḥ puratastasthurdvātriṃśatā bodhisattvasahasraiḥ
analyzed: te sarve yena bhagavān yena ca jetavanam vihāram tena upasaṅkrāntāḥ bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā abhivandya bhagavataḥ puratas tasthuḥ dvātriṃśatā bodhisattva sahasraiḥ
translated: All of them approached the Blessed One and the Jeta Grove monastery, bowed their heads at the feet of the Blessed One, and stood in front of the Blessed One together with 32,000 bodhisattvas,

original: tadyathā sahacittotpādadharmacakrapravartanena ca bodhisattvena mahāsattvena anikṣiptadhureṇa
analyzed: tat yathā saha citta utpāda dharma cakra pravartanena ca bodhisattvena mahāsattvena a nikṣipta dhureṇa
translated: namely with the bodhisattva mahasattva Sahashcittotpada-dharmachakra-pravartana, the bodhisattva mahasattva Anikshipta-dhura,🔽and others.

original: ca bodhisattvena mahāsattvena maitreyeṇa ca bodhisattvena mahāsattvena avalokiteśvareṇa
analyzed: ca bodhisattvena mahāsattvena maitreyeṇa ca bodhisattvena mahāsattvena avalokiteśvareṇa
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattva Maitreya, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara,

original: ca bodhisattvena mahāsattvena mahāsthāmaprāptena ca bodhisattvena mahāsattvena /
analyzed: ca bodhisattvena mahāsattvena mahāsthāmaprāptena ca bodhisattvena mahāsattvena
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattva Mahāsthāmaprāpta.

original: evampramukhairdātriṃśatā bodhisattvasahasraiḥ /
analyzed: evampramukhaiḥ dātriṃśatā bodhisattva sahasraiḥ
translated: These and thirty other thousand bodhisattvas.

original: te sarve yena bhagavān yena ca jetavanaṃ vihāraṃ tenopasaṅkrāntā bhagavataḥ pādau śirasābhivandya bhagavataḥ puratastasthuḥ /
analyzed: te sarve yena bhagavān yena ca jetavanam vihāram tena upasaṅkrāntāḥ bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā abhivandya bhagavataḥ puratas tasthuḥ
translated: All of them approached the Blessed One and the Jetavana monastery, bowed their heads at the feet of the Blessed One, and stood in front of the Blessed One.

original: atha khalu bhagavān pūrvāhṇakālasamaye nivāsya pātracīvaramātraḥ śrāvastīṃ mahānagarīṃ piṇḍāya prāviśat /🔽atha bhagavānāyuṣmantamānandamāmantrayate Asv sma /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān pūrvāhṇa kāla samaye nivāsya pātra cīvara mātraḥ śrāvastīm mahā nagarīm piṇḍāya prāviśat  atha bhagavān āyuṣmantam ānandam āmantrayate asu sma
translated: Then the Blessed One, in the morning, put on his lower robe and upper robe, took his bowl, and entered the great city of Śrāvastī for alms.

original: gacchānanda pātraṃ cakrikaṃ śikyamānaya /
analyzed: gaccha ānanda pātram cakrikam śikyam ānaya
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the Venerable Ānanda: Ānanda, go and bring me the bowl and the water strainer.

original: athāyuṣmānānando bhagavataḥ śrutamātreṇa pātraṃ cakrikaṃ śikyaṃ bhagavate upanāmayāmāsa /
analyzed: atha āyuṣmān ānandaḥ bhagavataḥ śruta mātreṇa pātram cakrikam śikyam bhagavate upanāmayāmāsa
translated: Then the Venerable Ānanda, as soon as he heard the Blessed One's words, brought the bowl, the water strainer, and the carrying net to the Blessed One.

original: athāyuṣmānānando bhagavataḥ kṛtāñjalipuṭo bhagavantaṃ gāthābhiradhyabhāṣata /
analyzed: atha āyuṣmān ānandaḥ bhagavataḥ kṛta añjali puṭaḥ bhagavantam gāthābhiḥ adhyabhāṣata
translated: Then the Venerable Ānanda, with palms joined in respect, addressed the Blessed One in verses:

original: yadā tvaṃ praviśasi piṇḍapātika vimocaye tvaṃ bahavaṃ hi prāṇinām /
analyzed: yadā tvam praviśasi piṇḍapātika vimocaye tvam bahavam hi prāṇinām
translated: When you enter for alms, you liberate many beings.

original: uttāraye tvaṃ bahavaṃ hi sattvā narakabhayājjātijarāmahābhayā //
analyzed: uttāraye tvam bahavam hi sattvāḥ naraka bhayāt jāti jarā mahā bhayā
translated: You deliver many beings from the fear of hell, from the great fear of birth and old age.

original: saṃsāraduḥkhakalilā mahābhayādvimocaye tvaṃ nara lokanāyaka /
analyzed: saṃsāra duḥkha kalilā mahā bhayāt vimocaye tvam nara loka nāyaka
translated: You liberate from the great fear of the suffering and turmoil of saṃsāra, O Guide of the World.

original: mahānubhāvo varadakṣiṇīyo vimocayitvā punaraṃ hi āgamī //
analyzed: mahā anubhāvaḥ vara dakṣiṇīyaḥ vimocayitvā hi āgamī
translated: Having liberated, you come again, O One of Great Power, O Bestower of Excellent Gifts.

original: athāyuṣmānānando bhagavata imā gāthā bhāṣitvā tūṣṇīṃ sthito 'bhūt /
analyzed: atha āyuṣmān ānandaḥ bhagavataḥ imāḥ gāthāḥ bhāṣitvā tūṣṇīm sthitaḥ bhūt
translated: Then the Venerable Ānanda, having spoken these verses to the Blessed One, remained silent.

original: atha bhagavān śrāvastyāṃ mahānagaryāṃ nātidūre sthito 'bhūt /
analyzed: atha bhagavān śrāvastyām mahā nagaryām na atidūre sthitaḥ bhūt
translated: Then the Blessed One was staying not far from the great city of Śrāvastī.

original: atha te sarve gavākṣatoraṇaniryūhakā hiraṇyamayāḥ sphaṭikamayā rūpyamayāḥ prādurabhūvan /
analyzed: atha te sarve gavākṣa toraṇa niryūhakāḥ hiraṇya mayāḥ sphaṭika mayāḥ rūpya mayāḥ prādurabhūvan
translated: Then all the windows, archways, and pinnacles made of gold, crystal, and silver appeared.

original: tathā śrāvastyāṃ mahānagaryāṃ mahāntaṃ janakāyaṃ saṃsthito 'bhūvan /
analyzed: tathā śrāvastyām mahā nagaryām mahāntam jana kāyam saṃsthitaḥ bhūvan
translated: And so a great crowd gathered in the great city of Śrāvastī.

original: atha sa janakāyaḥ saṃśayajāto babhūva ko hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ nagarasya śubhanimittaṃ prādurabhūt /
analyzed: atha sa jana kāyaḥ saṃśaya jātaḥ babhūva kaḥ hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ nagarasya śubha nimittam prādurabhūt
translated: Then that assembly became doubtful, wondering what the cause and condition was for the auspicious sign appearing in the city.

original: mā cedaṃ nagaraṃ bhasmapralayaṃ syāt /🔽atha tatra janakāye anekavarṣaśatasahasrakoṭīko Asv
analyzed: mā ca idam nagaram bhasma pralayam syāt  atha tatra jana kāye aneka varṣa śata sahasra koṭīkaḥ
translated: And that this city would not be destroyed by fire.🔽Then in that assembly there was an old man who had lived for many hundreds of thousands of koṭis of years,

original: vṛddhamahallakaḥ puruṣaḥ saṃsthito 'bhūt /
analyzed: vṛddha mahallakaḥ puruṣaḥ saṃsthitaḥ bhūt
translated: and he was standing there.

original: atha sa puruṣastaṃ janakāyaṃ samāśvāsayannevamāha /
analyzed: atha sa puruṣaḥ tam jana kāyam samāśvāsayan evam āha
translated: Then that man, comforting that assembly, said this:

original: mā bhaiṣurbhoḥ kulaputrāḥ /
analyzed: mā bhaiṣuḥ bhoḥ kula putrāḥ
translated: Do not be afraid, O sons of good family!

original: asminneva pṛthivīpradeśe jetavanaṃ nāma vihāraḥ /🔽tatra śākyamunirnāma tathāgato 'rhan samyaksambuddho vidyācaraṇasampannaḥ sugato lokavidanuttaraḥ puruṣadamyasārathiḥ śāstā devānāṃ ca manuṣyāṇāṃ
analyzed: asmin eva pṛthivī pradeśe jetavanam nāma vihāraḥ  tatra śākyamuniḥ nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksambuddhaḥ vidyā caraṇa sampannaḥ sugataḥ loka vid anuttaraḥ puruṣa damya sārathiḥ śāstā devānām ca manuṣyāṇām
translated: In this very place there is a monastery named Jetavana.

original: ca buddho bhagavān /
analyzed: ca buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: There dwells a Tathāgata named Śākyamuni, an Arhat, a Perfectly Enlightened One, perfect in knowledge and conduct, a Sugata, a knower of the world, an unsurpassed trainer of those who can be trained, a teacher of gods and humans, a Buddha, a Bhagavat.

original: so 'yaṃ śrāvastīṃ mahānagarīṃ piṇḍāya prāviśat /
analyzed: saḥ yam śrāvastīm mahā nagarīm piṇḍāya prāviśat
translated: He, the Blessed One, has entered the great city of Śrāvastī for alms.

original: tasyāgamanakālasamaye idaṃ śubhanimittamabhūt /
analyzed: tasya āgamana kāla samaye idam śubha nimittam abhūt
translated: At the time of his arrival, this auspicious sign appeared.

original: atha sa janakāyastaṃ jīrṇakaṃ puruṣaṃ kṛtāñjalirevamāha /
analyzed: atha sa jana kāyaḥ tam jīrṇakam puruṣam kṛtāñjaliḥ evam āha
translated: Then that assembly, with palms joined, said this to that old man:

original: yattasya bhagavatastathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksambuddhasya guṇavarṇasamudīraṇasamaye idaṃ śubhanimittamabhūt /
analyzed: yat tasya bhagavataḥ tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksambuddhasya guṇa varṇa samudīraṇa samaye idam śubha nimittam abhūt
translated: When the good signs appeared during the extolling of the qualities of that Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One,

original: dṛṣṭamātrasya tasya tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksambuddhasya kīdṛśaḥ puṇyābhisaṃskāro bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: dṛṣṭa mātrasya tasya tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksambuddhasya kīdṛśaḥ puṇya abhisaṃskāraḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: what kind of meritorious formation will there be for one who has merely seen that Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One?

original: atha sa jīrṇakapuruṣastaṃ janakāyaṃ bhagavato guṇavarṇasamudīraṇatayā gāthābhiradhyabhāṣata /
analyzed: atha sa jīrṇaka puruṣaḥ tam jana kāyam bhagavataḥ guṇa varṇa samudīraṇa tayā gāthābhiḥ adhyabhāṣata
translated: Then that old man addressed that assembly with verses, extolling the qualities of the Blessed One:

original: yo lokanāthasya hi nāmu yaḥ śruṇe saṃsāraduḥkhā vinimuktu so naro /
analyzed: yaḥ loka nāthasya hi yaḥ saṃsāra duḥkhā saḥ
translated: The person who hears the name of the Lord of the World will be freed from the sufferings of saṃsāra.

original: āpāyagāmī na kadāci bheṣyate svargaṃ ca so yāsyati śīghramevam //
analyzed: ā apāya gāmī na kadācid svargam ca saḥ yāsyati śīghram evam
translated: He will never go to the lower realms, and will quickly go to heaven.

original: yo lokanāthasya hi nāmu yaḥ śruṇe dṛḍhapratijño bahukalpakoṭibhiḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ loka nāthasya hi nāmu yaḥ śruṇe dṛḍha pratijñaḥ bahu kalpa koṭibhiḥ
translated: The one who hears the name of the Lord of the World, firm in his vow for many millions of eons,

original: mahānubhāvo sugato mahātmanaḥ kalpānakoṭīnayutānacintiyān // Asv
analyzed: sugataḥ mahātmanaḥ kalpān akoṭīn ayutān acintiyān
translated: the greatly powerful, the Sugata, the great being, for inconceivable trillions of eons,

original: so bodhisattvo sthita gaṅgavālukān kadāci so gacchati durgatī bhayam /
analyzed: saḥ bodhisattvaḥ gaṅga vālukān kadāci saḥ gacchati bhayam
translated: that bodhisattva, standing like the sands of the Ganges, will sometimes go to the fear of the lower realms.

original: yo lokanāthasya hi nāmu yaḥ śruṇe āpāyagāmī na kadāci bheṣyate //
analyzed: yaḥ loka nāthasya hi na amu yaḥ śruṇe ā apāya gāmī na kadācid
translated: The one who hears the name of the Lord of the World will never go to the lower realms.

original: kalpānakoṭīnayutānacintiyā rājā sa bhotī sada cakravartī /
analyzed: rājā sa cakravartī
translated: He becomes a king, a universal monarch, for countless quintillions of eons, always,

original: yo lokanāthasya hi nāmu dhārayet //
analyzed: yaḥ loka nāthasya hi nāmu dhārayet
translated: who upholds the name of the Lord of the World.

original: yat kiñci pūrvaṃ sada pāpu yat kṛtaṃ sarvaṃ kṣayaṃ yāsyati śīghrametat /
analyzed: yat kiñci pūrvam yat kṛtam sarvam kṣayam yāsyati śīghram etat
translated: Whatever bad actions have been done before, all of that will quickly be destroyed,

original: śakropi devendramahānubhāvo kalpānakoṭīnayutānacintiyā //
analyzed: deva indra mahā anubhāvaḥ
translated: Śakra, the lord of the gods of great power, for countless quintillions of eons,

original: sukhāvatīṃ gacchati buddhakṣetraṃ paryaṅkabaddho sa ca bodhisattvo /
analyzed: sukhāvatīm gacchati buddhakṣetram paryaṅka baddhaḥ sa ca bodhisattvaḥ
translated: goes to the buddha field of Sukhāvatī, that bodhisattva is bound to a throne,

original: brahmasvaro susvaru mañjughoṣa bhavanti varṣānasahasrakoṭibhiḥ //
analyzed: bhavanti varṣāna sahasra koṭibhiḥ
translated: he becomes one with the voice of Brahmā, a beautiful voice, a melodious voice, for billions of years.

original: apāyagāmī na kadāci bheṣyate yo lokanāthasya hi nāmu dhārayet /
analyzed: apāya gāmī na kadācid yaḥ loka nāthasya hi na amu dhārayet
translated: who upholds the name of the Lord of the World will never go to the lower realms.

original: atha sa jīrṇakaḥ purūṣo janakāyaṃ bhagavato guṇavarṇamudīrayitvā tūṣṇīṃ sthito 'bhūt /
analyzed: atha sa jīrṇakaḥ purūṣaḥ jana kāyam bhagavataḥ guṇa varṇam udīrayitvā tūṣṇīm sthitaḥ bhūt
translated: Then that old man, having extolled the qualities of the Blessed One to the assembly of people, remained silent.

original: atha bhagavān pūrveṇa nagaradvāreṇa śrāvastīṃ mahānagarīṃ praviṣṭo 'bhut /
analyzed: atha bhagavān pūrveṇa nagara dvāreṇa śrāvastīm mahā nagarīm praviṣṭaḥ bhud
translated: Then the Blessed One entered the great city of Śrāvastī through the eastern city gate.

original: tatra ca nagaradvāre dvādaśakoṭyaḥ padmānāṃ prādurabhūvan /
analyzed: tatra ca nagara dvāre dvādaśa koṭyaḥ padmānām prādurabhūvan
translated: And there, at that city gate, twelve koṭis of lotuses appeared.

original: teṣu ca padmeṣu dvādaśakoṭyo bodhisattvānāṃ paryaṅkaniṣaṇṇāḥ Asv
analyzed: teṣu ca padmeṣu dvādaśa koṭyaḥ bodhisattvānām paryaṅka niṣaṇṇāḥ
translated: And in those lotuses, twelve koṭis of bodhisattvas appeared, seated cross-legged,

original: prādurabhūvan prāñjalayaḥ /
analyzed: prādurabhūvan prāñjalayaḥ
translated: with folded hands.

original: atha bhagavataḥ praviṣṭamātreṇa śrāvastyāṃ mahānagaryāṃ navanavatikoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇi
analyzed: atha bhagavataḥ praviṣṭa mātreṇa śrāvastyām mahā nagaryām nava navati koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi
translated: Then, as soon as the Blessed One entered the great city of Śrāvastī, nine hundred and ninety koṭis of niyutas of hundreds of thousands

original: sattvānāṃ sukhāvatyāṃ lokadhātau pratiṣṭhāpitāni caturaśītisattvakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇyābhiratyā
analyzed: sattvānām sukhāvatyām lokadhātau pratiṣṭhāpitāni caturaśīti sattva koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi ā abhiratyā
translated: of beings were established in the world system Sukhāvatī, and eighty-four thousand koṭis of niyutas of hundreds of thousands of beings

original: lokadhātorakṣobhyatathāgatasya buddhakṣetre pratiṣṭhāpitāni /
analyzed: lokadhātoḥ akṣobhya tathāgatasya buddhakṣetre pratiṣṭhāpitāni
translated: were established in the buddha-field of the Tathāgata Akṣobhya in the world system Abhirati.

original: atha bhagavān ānandena saha nagaravalambikāyā dārikāya gṛhe samāgato 'bhūta /
analyzed: atha bhagavān ānandena saha nagara valambikāyāḥ dārikāya gṛhe samāgataḥ bhūta
translated: Then the Blessed One, together with Ānanda, arrived at the house of the girl Nagara-valambikā.

original: atha bhagavān nagaravalambikāyā dārikāyā gṛhe cakrikaṃ kaṭakaṭāpayāmāsa /
analyzed: atha bhagavān nagara valambikāyāḥ dārikāyāḥ gṛhe cakrikam kaṭakaṭāpayāmāsa
translated: Then the Blessed One made a rattling sound with his alms-bowl in the house of the girl Nagara-valambikā.

original: atha sā dārikā taṃ cakrīśabdaṃ śrutvā saṃśayajātābhūt /
analyzed: atha sā dārikā tam cakrī śabdam śrutvā saṃśaya jātā abhūt
translated: Then the girl, hearing that rattling sound of the bowl, became doubtful.

original: ko hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ /
analyzed: kaḥ hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ
translated: What is the cause, what is the condition?

original: mama gṛhe na kadācit piṇḍapātika āgato 'bhūt /
analyzed: mama gṛhe na kadācid piṇḍapātikaḥ āgataḥ bhūt
translated: Never before has a beggar come to my house.

original: atha sa nagaravalambikā dārikā śūnyākāragṛhe niṣaṇṇā aśrukaṇṭhī rudantī paridevantī sthitābhūt tīkṣṇadhāramasiṃ gaveṣantī paridevantī rudantī
analyzed: atha sa nagara avalambikā dārikā śūnya ākāra gṛhe niṣaṇṇā aśru kaṇṭhī rudantī paridevantī sthitā abhūt tīkṣṇa dhāram asim gaveṣantī paridevantī rudantī  /
translated: Then that girl Nagaravalam bhikṣuṇī, sitting in an empty house, with a choked voice, weeping and lamenting, remained seeking a sharp-edged sword, lamenting and crying.

original: sthitābhūt /
analyzed: sthitā abhūt
translated: She remained.

original: atha sā dārikā śūnyākāragṛhe niṣaṇṇā paridevantī aśrukaṇṭhī rudantī gāthābhiradhyabhāṣata /
analyzed: atha sā dārikā śūnya ākāra gṛhe niṣaṇṇā paridevantī aśru kaṇṭhī rudantī gāthābhiḥ adhyabhāṣata
translated: Then that girl, sitting in an empty house, lamenting, with a choked voice, crying, spoke these verses:

original: aho bata duḥkhu daridrake gṛhe varaṃ mama maraṇu na cāpi jīvitam /
analyzed: aho bata daridrake gṛhe varam mama na ca api jīvitam
translated: Alas, in this poor house, it is better for me to die than not to live.

original: kiṃ cāpi me kāryuṣu jīvitena yadyaivāhaṃ duḥkhu śarīra pīḍitam //🔽kana / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / /hyatrāṇaṃ bhavate parāyaṇam /
analyzed: kim ca api me jīvitena yadi eva aham  kanahyatrāṇam bhavate parāyaṇam
translated: What is the use of my living, if I am afflicted with suffering in this body?🔽For I am helpless, without a protector, without a refuge,

translated: Then the girl put on those silk garments, took the pearl necklace worth a hundred thousand, took the box of food with a hundred flavors, and approached the Blessed One.

analyzed: upasaṅkramya bhagavantam upanāmayati sma

translated: Then that girl, having transformed that alms-food,

original: bhagavantamupanāmayāmāsa /
analyzed: bhagavantam upanāmayāmāsa
translated: offered it to the Blessed One.

original: anena piṇḍapātakuśalamūlena mā kaśmiṃścid daridragṛhe upapadyeya /

original: pūrvejātinidānaṃ samanusmarāmi /

original: atha sā nagaravalambikā dārikā bhagavantaṃ gāthābhiradhyabhāṣata /

analyzed: karohi kāruṇya mama duḥkhitāyāḥ istri bhāvā upapannu nāyaka
translated: Have compassion on me, who am suffering! I have been born as a woman, O Leader!

original: tvaṃ lokanātha jaravyādhiśoka vimocaye maṃ mama duḥkhitāyāḥ //
analyzed: tvam lokanātha jara vyādhi śoka vimocaye mam mama duḥkhitāyāḥ
translated: O Lord of the World, free me from old age, disease, and sorrow, free me who am suffering!

original: trāṇaṃ bhavāhī śaraṇaṃ parāyaṇaṃ vimocayāhī mama duḥkhitāyāḥ /

translated: Be my refuge, my protection, my final resort! Liberate me who am suffering!

analyzed: sarve ca ham mocayi duḥkha sāgarāt trāṇam śaraṇam parāyaṇam

analyzed: bhavam tu nātha jara vyādhi mocakam trāṇam guṇa sañcita agra
translated: Be a protector, O Lord, who liberates from old age, disease, and suffering, be a refuge, O foremost one who has accumulated virtues.

translated: Those who in this Jambudvipa, in the future time, will uphold your name,

analyzed: atha bhagavān tām nagara avalambikām
translated: Then the Blessed One, to that girl Nagavalambika,

analyzed: atha sā dārikā pratinivṛtya evam āha

analyzed: avaśya me pāpu kṛtam su dāruṇam yena aham jātu daridrake gṛhe

translated: You are the caravan leader here in the world, liberate me from this state of a woman.

analyzed: trāṇam śaraṇam parāyaṇam kṛtajña aham bhavāmi nāyake

analyzed: atha bhagavān tām dārikām evam āha
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the girl:

translated: If you had not seen the form, gender, and appearance of that monk, young woman, in the future

translated: after incalculable, inconceivable eons, you will become a thus-gone one, a worthy one, a perfectly awakened one, perfect in knowledge and conduct, a sugata, a knower of the world, an unsurpassed guide for those to be tamed, a teacher of gods and humans, a buddha, a blessed one named Nāgadhvaja in the world.

analyzed: aparimitaguṇasañcayā nāma sā buddhakṣetram bhaviṣyati
translated: That Buddha field will be named Aparimitaguṇasañcaya.

original: yādṛaśī ca sā sukhāvatī lokadhātuḥ tādṛśaṃ tadbuddhakṣetraṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: yādṛaśī ca sā sukhāvatī lokadhātuḥ tādṛśam tat buddhakṣetram bhaviṣyati
translated: It will be like the world system Sukhāvatī.

original: paryaṅkaniṣaṇṇā āryopapādukā bodhisattvā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: paryaṅka niṣaṇṇāḥ ārya upapādukāḥ bodhisattvāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: The bodhisattvas there will be born miraculously, seated on lotus flowers.

original: īdṛśaṃ tadbuddhakṣetram / Asv
analyzed: īdṛśam tat buddhakṣetram
translated: Such will that Buddha field be.

original: atha ca sā dārikā tuṣṭā udagrā āttamanāḥ pramuditā prītisaumanasyajātā svagṛhagamanamārabdhā /
analyzed: atha ca sā dārikā tuṣṭā udagrā ātta manāḥ pramuditā prīti saumanasya jātā sva gṛha gamanam ārabdhā
translated: Then the girl, delighted, joyful, elated, and overjoyed, set out for her own home.

original: atha bhagavāṃstāṃ dārikāmevamāha /
analyzed: atha bhagavān tām dārikām evam āha
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the girl:

original: tvaṃ dārike saptame divase kālaṃ kariṣyasi /
analyzed: tvam dārike saptame divase kālam kariṣyasi
translated: Girl, you will die after seven days.

original: kālaṃ kṛtvā /
analyzed: kālam kṛtvā
translated: Having died,

original: pūrvasyāndiśi magadhaviṣaye rājā ajitaseno nāma /
analyzed: pūrvasyān diśi magadha viṣaye rājā ajitasenaḥ nāma
translated: in the eastern direction, in the Magadha country, there is a king named Ajitasena.

original: tasya rājño 'jitasenasya antaḥpurasahasramasti /
analyzed: tasya rājñaḥ jitasenasya antaḥpura sahasram asti
translated: That King Ajitasena has a thousand women in his harem.

original: tasya khalu punā rājño 'jitasenasya putro janiṣyase /
analyzed: tasya khalu punar rājñaḥ jitasenasya putraḥ janiṣyase
translated: You will be born as his son.

original: eṣa eva tava paścimo garbhavāso bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: eṣaḥ eva tava paścimaḥ garbha vāsaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: This will be your last birth in a womb.

original: atha bhagavān paścimakena nagaradvāreṇa śrāvastyā mahānagaryā niṣkrānto yena jetavanaṃ vihārastenopasaṅkrāntaḥ /
analyzed: atha bhagavān paścimakena nagara dvāreṇa śrāvastyāḥ mahā nagaryāḥ niṣkrāntaḥ yena jetavanam vihāraḥ tena upasaṅkrāntaḥ
translated: Then the Blessed One left the great city of Śrāvastī through the western city gate and went to the Jetavana monastery.

original: athāyuṣmānānando bhagavantaṃ dūrata evāgacchantaṃ dṛṣṭvā pādau śirasābhivandya triḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya bhagavantaṃ gāthābhiradhyabhāṣata /
analyzed: atha āyuṣmān ānandaḥ bhagavantam dūratas eva āgacchantam dṛṣṭvā pādau śirasā abhivandya tris pradakṣiṇīkṛtya bhagavantam gāthābhiḥ adhyabhāṣata
translated: Then the Venerable Ānanda, seeing the Blessed One coming from afar, bowed his head at the Blessed One's feet, circumambulated him three times, and addressed the Blessed One with these verses:

original: suvarṇavarṇaṃ varalakṣaṇārcitaṃ dvāviṃśatilakṣaṇarūpadhāriṇam /
analyzed: suvarṇa varṇam vara lakṣaṇa arcitam dvāviṃśati lakṣaṇa rūpa dhāriṇam
translated: You who are golden-colored, revered with the excellent marks, bearing the form of the twenty-two marks,

original: yadā tvayā āgatu piṇḍapātikā vimocayitvā iha sarvasattvā //
analyzed: yadā tvayā āgatu piṇḍapātikā vimocayitvā iha sarva sattvā
translated: When you came here for alms, you liberated all beings.

original: sukhena saṃsthāpayi sarvasattvā maitrībalaṃ sarvajagattvayā kṛtam /
analyzed: sukhena sarva sattvāḥ maitrī balam sarva jagat tvayā kṛtam
translated: You established all beings in happiness, you created the power of loving-kindness for all beings.

original: sa piṇḍapātaṃ varamāṇḍanāyaka vimocitaste jagatī bhayā ca //
analyzed: sa piṇḍapātam vara māṇḍa nāyaka vimocitaḥ te jagatī bhayā ca
translated: That alms offering, O excellent guide, was liberated by you, and the world was freed from fear.🔽Those bodhisattvas here in Jambudvīpa,

original: ye bodhisattvā iha jambudvīpe sarve ca mārgaṃ tava darśayanti /
analyzed: ye bodhisattvāḥ iha jambudvīpe sarve ca mārgam tava darśayanti
translated: all of them show you the path.

original: Asv parinirvṛtasya sada paścakāle dhāretu sūtram imu buddhavarṇitam //
analyzed: parinirvṛtasya sada paśca kāle buddha varṇitam
translated: Even after your parinirvāṇa, in the future, may they uphold this sūtra praised by the Buddha.

original: parinirvṛtasya tava paścakāle bhaviṣyati śāsanavipralopam /
analyzed: parinirvṛtasya tava paśca kāle bhaviṣyati śāsana vipralopam
translated: After your parinirvāṇa, in the future, when the teaching is disappearing,

original: imaṃ nayaṃ dhārayi sūtraratnam //
analyzed: imam nayam sūtra ratnam
translated: Will uphold this method, this precious sūtra.”

original: athāyuṣmānānanda imā gāthā bhāṣitvā bhagavantaṃ triḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya bhagavataḥ puratastasthau /
analyzed: atha āyuṣmān ānandaḥ imāḥ gāthāḥ bhāṣitvā bhagavantam tris pradakṣiṇīkṛtya bhagavataḥ puratas tasthau
translated: Then, after the venerable Ānanda had spoken these verses, he circumambulated the Blessed One three times and stood in front of the Blessed One.

original: atha bhagavānāyuṣmantamānandamāmantrayate sma /
analyzed: atha bhagavān āyuṣmantam ānandam āmantrayate sma
translated: Then the Blessed One addressed the venerable Ānanda:

original: gacchānanda gaṇḍīmākoṭaya /
analyzed: gaccha ānanda gaṇḍīm ākoṭaya
translated: Go, Ānanda, and beat the gong.

original: te śrāvakāḥ paribhokṣyanti piṇḍapātam /
analyzed: te śrāvakāḥ paribhokṣyanti piṇḍapātam
translated: Those disciples will enjoy the alms-food.

original: athāyuṣmānānando bhagavantamāmantrayate sma /
analyzed: atha āyuṣmān ānandaḥ bhagavantam āmantrayate sma
translated: Then the venerable Ānanda addressed the Blessed One:

original: kīdṛśaṃ bhagavan gaṇḍīśabdasya kuśalamūlaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: kīdṛśam bhagavan gaṇḍī śabdasya kuśala mūlam bhaviṣyati
translated: What kind of wholesome root will there be, Blessed One, from the sound of the gong?

original: bhagavānāha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: śṛṇu ānanda gaṇḍīśabdasya kuśalamūlaṃ parikīrtayāmi /
analyzed: śṛṇu ānanda gaṇḍī śabdasya kuśala mūlam parikīrtayāmi
translated: Listen, Ānanda, I will proclaim the wholesome root from the sound of the gong.

original: ye kecidānanda gaṇḍīśabdaṃ śroṣyanti teṣāṃ pañcānantaryāṇi kṛtyāni parikṣayaṃ yāsyanti /
analyzed: ye kecid ānanda gaṇḍī śabdam śroṣyanti teṣām pañca ānantaryāṇi kṛtyāni parikṣayam yāsyanti
translated: Ānanda, whoever hears the sound of the gong will have their five immediate karmas completely destroyed.

original: avaivartikāste bhaviṣyanti kṣipraṃ cānuttarāṃ samyaksambodhimabhisambhotsyante /
analyzed: a vaivartikāḥ te bhaviṣyanti kṣipram ca anuttarām samyaksambodhim abhisambhotsyante
translated: They will become irreversible and will quickly attain the highest complete enlightenment.

original: ānanda āha /
analyzed: ānandaḥ āha
translated: Ānanda said:

original: kīdṛśaṃ bhagavaṃstaiḥ sattvaiḥ kuśalamūlamavaropim /
analyzed: kīdṛśam bhagavan taiḥ sattvaiḥ kuśala mūlam avaropim
translated: Blessed One, what kind of wholesome root have those beings planted?

original: bhagavānāha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: śṛṇu ānanda ye sattvāḥ paścime kāle paścime samaye mama parinirvṛtasya saddharmavipralope
analyzed: śṛṇu ānanda ye sattvāḥ paścime kāle paścime samaye mama parinirvṛtasya saddharma vipralope
translated: Listen, Ānanda, those beings in the later times, in the later five hundred years, after I have passed into Nirvāṇa, when the true Dharma is disappearing,

original: vartamāne saddharmasyāntardhānakālasamaye grāmanagaranigamajanapadarāṣṭrarājadhānīṣu
analyzed: vartamāne saddharmasya antardhāna kāla samaye grāma nagara nigama janapada rāṣṭra rājadhānīṣu
translated: when the time has come for the true Dharma to disappear in villages, towns, cities, countries, states, and capitals,

original: ye sattvā vā araṇyāyatane gaṇḍayākoṭanaśabdaṃ śroṣyanti namo buddhāyeti kariṣyanti
analyzed: ye sattvāḥ vā araṇya āyatane gaṇḍayā koṭana śabdam śroṣyanti namaḥ buddhāya iti kariṣyanti
translated: those beings who will hear the sound of the beating of the Gandī in the forest, and will say Homage to the Buddha,

original: teṣāṃ pañcānantaryāṇi karmāṇi parikṣayaṃ Asv yāsyanti /
analyzed: teṣām pañca ānantaryāṇi karmāṇi parikṣayam yāsyanti
translated: their five acts of immediate retribution will be completely destroyed.

original: īdṛśānyānanda gaṇḍīśabdasya kuśalamūlāni /
analyzed: īdṛśāni ānanda gaṇḍī śabdasya kuśala mūlāni
translated: Such are the roots of goodness of the sound of the Gandī, Ānanda.

original: athāyuṣmānānandaḥ śāntapraśāntena gaṇḍīmākoṭayate sma /
analyzed: atha āyuṣmān ānandaḥ śānta praśāntena gaṇḍīm ākoṭayate sma
translated: Then the Venerable Ānanda beat the Gandī with a peaceful and tranquil mind.

original: atha tena gaṇḍīśabdena sarve te mahāśrāvakāḥ sannipatitā abhūvan /
analyzed: atha tena gaṇḍī śabdena sarve te mahāśrāvakāḥ sannipatitāḥ abhūvan
translated: Then by the sound of that Gandī, all those great hearers assembled.

original: yathā yathā āsane niṣaṇṇāḥ piṇḍapātaṃ paribhuñjante sma /🔽atha tatraiva śrāvakamadhye nandimitro nāma mahāśrāvakaḥ sannipatito 'bhūt sanniṣaṇṇaḥ /
analyzed: yathā yathā āsane niṣaṇṇāḥ piṇḍapātam paribhuñjante sma  atha tatra eva śrāvaka madhye nandimitraḥ nāma mahāśrāvakaḥ sannipatitaḥ bhūt sanniṣaṇṇaḥ
translated: As they sat in their seats, they ate their alms-food.🔽Then right there among the hearers, a great hearer named Nandimitra had assembled and was seated.🔽Then the Blessed One addressed the great hearer Venerable Nandimitra:

original: atha bhagavānāyuṣmantaṃ nandimitraṃ mahāśrāvakamāmantrayate sma /
analyzed: atha bhagavān āyuṣmantam nandimitram mahāśrāvakam āmantrayate sma
translated: Nandimitra, Nandimitra!

original: gaccha tvaṃ nandimitra mahāśrāvaka pūrvasyāndiśi magadhaviṣaye rājño 'jitasenasya kalyāṇamitraparicaryāṃ kuru /
analyzed: gaccha tvam nandimitra mahāśrāvaka pūrvasyān diśi magadha viṣaye rājñaḥ jitasenasya kalyāṇa mitra paricaryām kuru
translated: Go, Nandimitra, great disciple, to the east, to the Magadha country, and serve King Ajitasena as a spiritual friend.

original: atha nandimitro mahāśrāvako bhagavantamevamāha /
analyzed: atha nandimitraḥ mahāśrāvakaḥ bhagavantam evam āha
translated: Then the great disciple Nandimitra said to the Blessed One:

original: na bhagavan śakṣyāmastaṃ pṛthivīpradeśaṃ gantum /
analyzed: na bhagavan śakṣyāmaḥ tam pṛthivī pradeśam gantum
translated: Blessed One, we will not be able to go to that region of the earth.

original: durāsadāste sattvāḥ /
analyzed: durāsadāḥ te sattvāḥ
translated: Those beings are difficult to approach.

original: te māṃ jīvitādvyavaropayiṣyanti /
analyzed: te mām jīvitāt vyavaropayiṣyanti
translated: They will deprive me of life.

original: atha bhagavānāyuṣmantaṃ taṃ nandimitraṃ mahāśrāvakamevamāha /
analyzed: atha bhagavān āyuṣmantam tam nandimitram mahāśrāvakam evam āha
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable great disciple Nandimitra:

original: na te sattvāste śakṣyante bālāgramapi kampayituṃ prāgeva jīvitādvyavaropayitum /
analyzed: na te sattvāḥ te śakṣyante bālāgram api kampayitum prāk eva jīvitāt vyavaropayitum
translated: Those beings will not be able to make even the tip of a hair tremble, let alone deprive you of life.

original: atha nandimitro mahāśrāvakaḥ pratyūṣakālasamaye suvarṇavarṇaṃ vastraṃ prāvṛtya yena pūrvasyāndiśi magadhaviṣaye rājño 'jitasenasya rājadhānī
analyzed: atha nandimitraḥ mahāśrāvakaḥ pratyūṣa kāla samaye suvarṇa varṇam vastram prāvṛtya yena pūrvasyān diśi magadha viṣaye rājñaḥ jitasenasya rājadhānī  /
translated: Then the great disciple Nandimitra, at dawn, having put on a golden-colored robe, went to the east, to the Magadha country, to the capital of King Ajitasena

original: tenānukrānto 'bhut /
analyzed: tena anukrāntaḥ bhuj
translated: and arrived there.

original: atha rājā ajitasenastaṃ nandimitraṃ mahāśrāvakaṃ dṛṣṭvā tuṣṭa udagra āttamanāḥ pramuditaḥ prītisaumanasyajāto 'bhūt /
analyzed: atha rājā ajitasenaḥ tam nandimitram mahāśrāvakam dṛṣṭvā tuṣṭaḥ udagraḥ ātta manāḥ pramuditaḥ prīti saumanasya jātaḥ bhūt
translated: Then King Ajitasena, having seen the great disciple Nandimitra, became pleased, delighted, joyful, and elated, and was filled with joy and happiness.

original: atha rājñājitasenena amātyaḥ preṣito 'bhūt /
analyzed: atha rājñā ajitasenena amātyaḥ preṣitaḥ bhūt
translated: Then King Ajitasena sent a minister, saying,

original: gacchainaṃ bhikṣumānaya /🔽tadā so 'mātyo yena nandimitro mahāśrāvakastenopasaṅkrāntaḥ Asv /
analyzed: gaccha enam bhikṣum ānaya  tadā saḥ mātyaḥ yena nandimitraḥ mahāśrāvakaḥ tena upasaṅkrāntaḥ
translated: Go and bring that monk.🔽Then that minister approached the great disciple Nandimitra.

original: atha so 'mātyo nandimitraṃ mahāśrāvakamevamāha /
analyzed: atha saḥ mātyaḥ nandimitram mahāśrāvakam evam āha
translated: Then that minister said to the great disciple Nandimitra,

original: āgaccha mahāśrāvaka bhikṣo rājā te ājñāpayati /
analyzed: āgaccha mahāśrāvaka bhikṣo rājā te ājñāpayati
translated: Come, great disciple, the king commands you.

original: atha nandimitro mahāśrāvako 'mātyamevamāha /
analyzed: atha nandimitraḥ mahāśrāvakaḥ mātyam evam āha
translated: Then the great disciple Nandimitra said to the minister,

original: mama rājñā kiṃ kāryaṃ mama rājā kiṃ kariṣyati /
analyzed: mama rājñā kim kāryam mama rājā kim kariṣyati
translated: What business do I have with the king? What will the king do to me?

original: athāmātyo yena rājājitasenastenopasaṅkrāntaḥ /
analyzed: atha amātyaḥ yena rājā ajitasenaḥ tena upasaṅkrāntaḥ
translated: Then the minister approached King Ajitasena

original: taṃ rājānamajitasenamevamāha /
analyzed: tam rājānam ajitasenam evam āha
translated: and said to him,

original: na ca sa bhikṣustava pārśve āgacchati /
analyzed: na ca sa bhikṣuḥ tava pārśve āgacchati
translated: But that monk does not come to your side.

original: atha rājñājitasenena pañcāmātyaśatāni preṣitāni /🔽na ca sa bhikṣūrājño
analyzed: atha rājñā ajitasenena pañca amātya śatāni preṣitāni  na ca sa bhikṣu rājñaḥ
translated: Then King Ajitasena sent five hundred ministers,

original: 'jitasenasya pārśvamāgacchati /
analyzed: jitasenasya pārśvam āgacchati
translated: but that monk did not come to the side of King Ajitasena.

original: atha sa rājā svakenaivātmabhāvena yena sa nandimitramahāśrāvakastenopasaṅkrāntaḥ /
analyzed: atha sa rājā svakena eva ātmabhāvena yena sa nandimitra mahāśrāvakaḥ tena upasaṅkrāntaḥ
translated: Then the king himself approached the great disciple Nandimitra,

original: upasaṅkramya kṛtāñjalirevamāha /
analyzed: upasaṅkramya kṛtāñjaliḥ evam āha
translated: and having approached, with folded hands he said,

original: āgaccha bho bhikṣo mama rājadhānīṃ praviśa /
analyzed: āgaccha bho bhikṣo mama rājadhānīm praviśa
translated: Come, monk, enter my royal palace.

original: atha rājā ajitaseno dakṣiṇahaste taṃ bhikṣuṃ gṛhītvā svakāṃ rājadhānīṃ praviṣṭo 'bhūt /
analyzed: atha rājā ajitasenaḥ dakṣiṇa haste tam bhikṣum gṛhītvā svakām rājadhānīm praviṣṭaḥ bhūt
translated: Then King Ajitasena, taking that monk by the right hand, entered his own royal palace.

original: atha rājñājitasenena nandimitrasya bhikṣoḥ siṃhāsanaṃ dattamabhut /
analyzed: atha rājñā ajitasenena nandimitrasya bhikṣoḥ siṃhāsanam dattam abhut
translated: Then King Ajitasena gave a lion throne to the monk Nandimitra.

original: atha rājājitaseno bhadrapīṭhake niṣadya taṃ nandimitraṃ mahāśrāvakamevamāha /
analyzed: atha rājā ajitasenaḥ bhadrapīṭhake niṣadya tam nandimitram mahāśrāvakam evam āha
translated: Then King Ajitasena, sitting on the auspicious seat, said this to the great disciple Nandimitra:

original: kutra tvaṃ bhikṣo gacchasi /
analyzed: kutra tvam bhikṣo gacchasi
translated: Where are you going, monk?

original: ko hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ /
analyzed: kaḥ hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ
translated: What is the cause, what is the condition?

original: atha nandimitro mahāśrāvako rājānamajitasenamevamāha /
analyzed: atha nandimitraḥ mahāśrāvakaḥ rājānam ajitasenam evam āha
translated: Then the great disciple Nandimitra said this to King Ajitasena:

original: ye kecid bhikṣupravrajitāste sarve bhikṣāhārāḥ piṇḍapātamavacarantaḥ paribhuñjanti /
analyzed: ye kecid bhikṣu pravrajitāḥ te sarve bhikṣāhārāḥ piṇḍapātam avacarantaḥ paribhuñjanti
translated: Those who have gone forth as monks, all of them, live on alms, wandering and receiving alms-food.

original: atha rājā ajitasenastaṃ nandimitraṃ mahāśrāvakamevamāha /
analyzed: atha rājā ajitasenaḥ tam nandimitram mahāśrāvakam evam āha
translated: Then King Ajitasena said this to the great disciple Nandimitra:

original: paribhuṅkṣva mama gṛhe piṇḍapātam /
analyzed: paribhuṅkṣva mama gṛhe piṇḍapātam
translated: Eat alms-food in my house.

original: yāvajjīvaṃ piṇḍapātaṃ pradāsyāmi /
analyzed: yāvajjīvam piṇḍapātam pradāsyāmi
translated: As long as I live, I will give alms-food.

original: yadi te bhikṣo mama svamāṃsena kāryaṃ svamāṃsaṃ dāsyāmi /
analyzed: yadi te bhikṣo mama sva māṃsena kāryam sva māṃsam dāsyāmi
translated: If, monk, you have need for my own flesh, I will give you my own flesh.

original: atha nandimitro mahāśrāvako rājānamajitasenaṃ gāthābhiradhyabhāṣata / Asv
analyzed: atha nandimitraḥ mahāśrāvakaḥ rājānam ajitasenam gāthābhiḥ adhyabhāṣata
translated: Then the great disciple Nandimitra spoke these verses to King Ajitasena:

original: bhuñjāmi tadbhojanu yad dadāhi mṛṣṭānnapānaṃ rasapānamuktamam /
analyzed: bhuñjāmi yat dadāhi mṛṣṭa anna pānam
translated: I will eat the food you give, the delicious food and drink, the nectar-like drink.

original: kleśā hi nirmukta tvayā bhaviṣyasi sudurlabhaṃ labdha manuṣyalābham //
analyzed: kleśāḥ hi nirmukta tvayā bhaviṣyasi su durlabham labdha manuṣya lābham
translated: You will be liberated from afflictions. Having obtained human birth, so difficult to obtain,

original: sudurlabhaṃ śāsanu nāyakasya śraddhāprasādaṃ paramaṃ sudurlabham /
analyzed: su durlabham nāyakasya śraddhā prasādam paramam su durlabham
translated: The teaching of the Guide is very difficult to obtain. Faith and clear faith are extremely difficult to obtain.

original: ye śāsane pravrajitā ca bhikṣavā sudurlabhaṃ śāsanu nāyakānām //
analyzed: ye śāsane ca bhikṣavā su durlabham nāyakānām
translated: Those who go forth in the teaching as monks, the teaching of the Guides is very difficult to obtain.

original: sudurlabhaṃ sugatavarasya darśanaṃ namo 'stu te buddha mahānubhāvo /
analyzed: su durlabham sugata varasya darśanam namaḥ stu te buddha mahā anubhāvaḥ
translated: Homage to you, Buddha of great power, whose vision is so difficult to obtain, O excellent Sugata.

original: namo 'stu te dharmamayaṃ mahāmune namo 'stu te kleśavicakṣaṇāryam //
analyzed: namaḥ stu te dharma mayam mahā mune namaḥ stu te kleśa vicakṣaṇa āryam
translated: Homage to you, O great sage, whose nature is Dharma, homage to you, O noble one who is skilled in afflictions.

original: namo 'stu te sarvajarapramokṣaṇāt namo 'stu te mārganidarśanāryam /
analyzed: namaḥ stu te sarva jara pramokṣaṇāt namaḥ stu te mārga nidarśana āryam
translated: Homage to you, who liberate all from old age, homage to you, O noble one who shows the path.

original: namo 'stu te mārgapathasya darśakaṃ namo 'stu te bodhipathasya darśakam //
analyzed: namaḥ stu te mārga pathasya darśakam namaḥ stu te bodhi pathasya darśakam
translated: Homage to you, who show the path, homage to you, who show the path to enlightenment.

original: atha nandimitro mahāśrāvako rājānamajitasenaṃ bhagavato guṇavarṇamudīrayitvā tūṣṇīṃ sthito 'bhūt /
analyzed: atha nandimitraḥ mahāśrāvakaḥ rājānam ajitasenam bhagavataḥ guṇa varṇam udīrayitvā tūṣṇīm sthitaḥ bhūt
translated: Then the great disciple Nandimitra, having extolled the virtues of the Blessed One to King Ajitasena, remained silent.

original: atha rājānamajitasenaṃ taṃ nandimitro mahāśrāvako gāthābhiradhyabhāṣata /
analyzed: atha rājānam ajitasenam tam nandimitraḥ mahāśrāvakaḥ gāthābhiḥ adhyabhāṣata
translated: Then the great disciple Nandimitra spoke these verses to King Ajitasena:

original: sudurlabhaṃ bhikṣu tathaiva darśanaṃ sudurlabhaṃ tasya bhaveya darśanam / Asv
analyzed: su durlabham bhikṣu tathā eva darśanam su durlabham tasya bhaveya darśanam
translated: It is very difficult, O monk, to see him, it would be very difficult to see him,

original: ye bhikṣusaṅghasya dadeya dānaṃ na tasya yakṣā na ca rākṣasāśca //
analyzed: ye bhikṣu saṅghasya dadeya dānam na tasya yakṣāḥ na ca rākṣasāḥ ca
translated: For those who give alms to the assembly of monks, the yakshas, the rakshasas,

original: na pretakuṣmāṇḍamahoragāśca vighnaṃ na kurvanti kadāci teṣām /
analyzed: na preta kuṣmāṇḍa mahā uragāḥ ca vighnam na kurvanti kadācid teṣām
translated: The pretas, the kumbhandas, and the mahoragas will never create obstacles for them.

original: ye bhikṣusaṅghāya dadanti dānaṃ sudurlabhaṃ tasya manuṣyalābham //
analyzed: ye bhikṣu saṅghāya dadanti dānam su durlabham tasya manuṣya lābham
translated: For those who give alms to the assembly of monks, it is very difficult for them to obtain a human birth.

original: yo durlabhaṃ darśanu bhikṣubhāvaṃ sudurlabhaṃ kalpaśatairacintiyaiḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ durlabham bhikṣu bhāvam su durlabham kalpa śataiḥ acintiyaiḥ
translated: He who obtains the difficult-to-obtain state of a monk, which is very difficult to obtain in inconceivable hundreds of eons,

original: yo lokanāthasya hi nāmu dhāraye kalpāna koṭīnayutānacintiyā //
analyzed: yaḥ lokanāthasya hi dhāraye
translated: And who would remember the name of the Lord of the World for inconceivable quintillions of eons,

original: na jātu gacche vinipātadurgatiṃ yo īdṛśaṃ paśyati bhikṣurājam /
analyzed: na jātu gacche vinipāta durgatim īdṛśam paśyati bhikṣu rājam
translated: He will never go to the lower realms and unfortunate destinies, who sees such a king of monks.

original: na tasya bhotī vinipātadurgatiṃ yo īdṛśaṃ paśyati bhikṣurājam //
analyzed: na tasya vinipāta durgatim īdṛśam paśyati bhikṣu rājam
translated: For him there will be no lower realms and unfortunate destinies, who sees such a king of monks.

original: kalyāṇamitraṃ mama mārgadarśako yaṃ
analyzed: kalyāṇa mitram mama mārga darśakaḥ yam
translated: He is my good friend, the one who shows me the path,

original: sa āgatāye mama piṇḍapātikā /
analyzed: saḥ āgatā āye mama piṇḍapātikā
translated: To whom I, the one who lives on alms, have come.

original: yo dāsyate asya hi piṇḍapātaṃ muktā na bheṣyanti jarārtavyādhayā //
analyzed: yaḥ dāsyate asya hi piṇḍapātam muktāḥ na jarā ārta vyādhayā
translated: Whoever offers him alms will be free from old age, sickness, and death.

original: kleśā vinirmukta sadā tu bheṣyati ye tasya dāsyantiha piṇḍapātam //
analyzed: sadā tu ye tasya dāsyanti iha piṇḍapātam
translated: They will always be free from afflictions who offer him alms here.

original: atha sa rājā ajitaseno nandimitraṃ mahāśrāvakaṃ guṇavarṇamudīrayitvā tūṣṇīṃ sthito 'bhūt /
analyzed: atha sa rājā ajitasenaḥ nandimitram mahāśrāvakam guṇa varṇam udīrayitvā tūṣṇīm sthitaḥ bhūt
translated: Then King Ajitasena, having praised the qualities of the great disciple Nandimitra, remained silent.

original: atha nandimitro mahāśrāvako Asv
analyzed: atha nandimitraḥ mahāśrāvakaḥ
translated: Then the great disciple Nandimitra

original: rājānamajitasenamevamāha /
analyzed: rājānam ajitasenam evam āha
translated: said this to King Ajitasena:

original: evamastu mahārāja bhuñje piṇḍapāta tava gṛhe /🔽atha rājā ajitasenaḥ khādanīyena bhojanīyena taṃ nandimitramahāśrāvakaṃ santarpayati sma /
analyzed: evam astu mahā rāja bhuñje piṇḍapāta tava gṛhe  atha rājā ajitasenaḥ khādanīyena bhojanīyena tam nandimitra mahāśrāvakam santarpayati sma
translated: So be it, great king. I will eat alms in your house.🔽Then King Ajitasena satisfied the great disciple Nandimitra with food to chew and food to drink.

original: atha nandimitramahāśrāvako rājānamajitasenamevamāha /
analyzed: atha nandimitra mahāśrāvakaḥ rājānam ajitasenam evam āha
translated: Then the great disciple Nandimitra said this to King Ajitasena:

original: kiṃ tava mahārāja asmin pṛthivīpradeśe udyānabhūmirasti /
analyzed: kim tava mahā rāja asmin pṛthivī pradeśe udyāna bhūmiḥ asti
translated: Great king, do you have a pleasure garden on this piece of land?

original: rājā āha /
analyzed: rājā āha
translated: The king said:

original: asti mahāśrāvaka udyānabhūmirmama ramaṇīyā suśobhanā /
analyzed: asti mahāśrāvakaḥ udyāna bhūmiḥ mama ramaṇīyā su śobhanā
translated: Great disciple, I have a delightful and beautiful pleasure garden.

original: nandimitra āha /
analyzed: nandimitraḥ āha
translated: Nandimitra said:

original: gacchāmyahaṃ mahārāja /
analyzed: gacchāmi aham mahā rāja
translated: Great king, I will go.

original: tāmudyānabhūmiṃ prekṣe /
analyzed: tām udyāna bhūmim prekṣe
translated: I will see that pleasure garden.

original: rājā āha /
analyzed: rājā āha
translated: The king said:

original: gaccha nandimitra /
analyzed: gaccha nandi mitra
translated: Go, Nandimitra.

original: udyānabhūmiṃ prekṣasva /
analyzed: udyāna bhūmim prekṣasva
translated: Look at the pleasure grove.

original: atha nandimitramahāśrāvako yena rājño 'jitasenasyodyānabhūmistenopasaṅkrāntaḥ /
analyzed: atha nandimitra mahāśrāvakaḥ yena rājñaḥ jitasenasya udyāna bhūmiḥ tena upasaṅkrāntaḥ
translated: Then the great hearer Nandimitra went to the pleasure grove of King Ajitasena.

original: atha tatrodyānabhūmau ye udyānaguṇāste sarve santīti /
analyzed: atha tatra udyāna bhūmau ye udyāna guṇāḥ te sarve santi iti
translated: Then in that pleasure grove, all the qualities of a pleasure grove were present.

original: yā graiṣmikyaḥ puṣkariṇyastāḥ śītalajalaparipūrṇā yā vārṣikyastā nātyuṣṇā nātiśītalajalaparipūrṇāḥ /
analyzed: yāḥ graiṣmikyaḥ puṣkariṇyaḥ tāḥ śītala jala paripūrṇāḥ yāḥ vārṣikyaḥ tāḥ na ati uṣṇāḥ na ati śītala jala paripūrṇāḥ
translated: The summer ponds were filled with cool water, and the rainy season ponds were filled with neither too hot nor too cold water.

original: tāśca puṣkariṇyaḥ suvarṇasopānasañcchannā divyā ramaṇīyāḥ /
analyzed: tāḥ ca puṣkariṇyaḥ suvarṇa sopāna sañchannāḥ divyāḥ ramaṇīyāḥ
translated: Those ponds were covered with golden stairs, divine and delightful.

original: ye ca jāmbūpakaparibhogaguṇāste sarve santīti /
analyzed: ye ca jāmbūpaka paribhoga guṇāḥ te sarve santi iti
translated: And all the qualities of enjoyment for the people of Jambudvīpa were present.

original: adhimuktakacampakāśokamucilindapāṭalasumanāsaugandhikapuṣpāṇi santīti /
analyzed: adhimuktaka campaka aśoka mucilinda pāṭala sumanā saugandhika puṣpāṇi santi iti
translated: There were flowers of adhimuktaka, campaka, aśoka, mucilinda, pāṭala, sumanas, and saugandhika.

original: Asv ye tiryagyonigatāḥ pakṣiṇaḥ śukaśārikācakravākamayūrakokilādayaste nānārutāni kurvanti sma /
analyzed: ye tiryagyoni gatāḥ pakṣiṇaḥ śuka śārikā cakravāka mayūra kokila ādayaḥ te nānā rutāni kurvanti sma
translated: And those birds of the animal realm, such as parrots, mynas, ruddy geese, peacocks, and cuckoos, made various sounds.

original: atha tatraiva udyānabhūmau suvarṇavarṇāḥ suvarṇatuṇḍāḥ suvarṇapakṣāḥ suvarṇapādāḥ pakṣiṇaḥ prādurbhūtāḥ /
analyzed: atha tatra eva udyāna bhūmau suvarṇa varṇāḥ suvarṇa tuṇḍāḥ suvarṇa pakṣāḥ suvarṇa pādāḥ pakṣiṇaḥ prādurbhūtāḥ
translated: Then in that very pleasure grove, golden-colored birds appeared, with golden beaks, golden wings, and golden feet.

original: te sarve buddhaśabdaṃ niścārayanti /
analyzed: te sarve buddha śabdam niścārayanti
translated: They all uttered the sound of the Buddha.

original: atha nandimitramahāśrāvako yena rājño 'jitasenasya rājadhānī tenopasaṅkrāntaḥ /
analyzed: atha nandimitra mahāśrāvakaḥ yena rājñaḥ jitasenasya rājadhānī tena upasaṅkrāntaḥ
translated: Then the great disciple Nandimitra went to the capital of King Ajitasena.

original: atha rājā ajitasenastaṃ nandimitraṃ mahāśrāvakamevamāha /
analyzed: atha rājā ajitasenaḥ tam nandimitram mahāśrāvakam evam āha
translated: Then King Ajitasena said to that great disciple Nandimitra:

original: āgatastvaṃ mahāśrāvaka /
analyzed: āgataḥ tvam mahāśrāvaka
translated: You have come, great disciple.

original: dṛṣṭodyānabhūmiḥ /
analyzed: dṛṣṭa udyāna bhūmiḥ
translated: Have you seen the pleasure grove?

original: nandimitra āha /
analyzed: nandimitraḥ āha
translated: Nandimitra said:

original: dṛṣṭā mayodyānabhūmī ramaṇīyā suśobhanā /
analyzed: dṛṣṭā mayā udyāna bhūmiḥ ramaṇīyā su śobhanā
translated: I have seen the delightful and beautiful pleasure grove.

original: atha nandimitraṃ mahāśrāvakaṃ rājā ajitaseno gāthābhiradhyabhāṣata /
analyzed: atha nandimitram mahāśrāvakam rājā ajitasenaḥ gāthābhiḥ adhyabhāṣata
translated: Then King Ajitasena addressed the great disciple Nandimitra in verse:

analyzed: ye jambudvīpe paribhoga māsī adhimuktaka campaka dhānuṣkārikā
translated: The enjoyments in Jambudvipa, such as the adhimuka campaka, the dhanushka,

analyzed: tathā eva pāṭalā saugandhikāḥ ca sumanā ca vārṣikā
translated: The ashoka, the mucilinda, the patala, the sugandhika, the sumana, and the varshika,

analyzed: tadā pāriyātrā nadī tīra nirmitā suvarṇa varṇā abhūt
translated: At that time, on the banks of the river Paripatra, there was a golden-colored bird created,

analyzed: mārgam ca te agra bodhaye
translated: And they will show you the path to supreme enlightenment,🔽And they will always make you hear

analyzed: divyāḥ manojñāḥ madhura svarān ca  saṃśrāvayiṣyanti ca nityakālam
translated: The divine, delightful, sweet sounds.

original: atha nandimitramahāśrāvako rājño 'jitasenasya gāthā bhāṣitvā tūṣṇīṃ sthito 'bhūt /
analyzed: atha nandimitra mahāśrāvakaḥ rājñaḥ jitasenasya gāthāḥ bhāṣitvā tūṣṇīm sthitaḥ bhūt
translated: Then the great disciple Nandimitra, having spoken the verse to King Ajitasena, remained silent.

original: atha rājā ajitaseno bherīṃ parāhante sma /
analyzed: atha rājā ajitasenaḥ bherīm parāhante sma
translated: Then King Ajitasena had a drum beaten.

analyzed: atha tena bherī śabdena sametya amātya gaṇaḥ tam rājānam ajitasenam evam āha
translated: Then, having assembled with that sound of the drum, the group of ministers said this to King Ajitasena:

analyzed: kasya arthe mahā rāja bherī parāhatā
translated: For whose sake, great king, was the drum beaten?

original: atha sa rājā āha /
analyzed: atha sa rājā āha
translated: Then the king said:

original: hastirathaṃ ca aśvarathaṃ ca sajjaṃ kṛtaṃ syāt /
analyzed: hasti ratham ca aśva ratham ca sajjam kṛtam syāt

analyzed: atha tāḥ amātya koṭyaḥ vacanam śrutvā śīghram eva tat hasti ratham aśva ratham sajjam kṛtavatyaḥ
translated: Then, having heard those words, the ten million ministers quickly made ready the elephant chariot and the horse chariot.

original: atha tena kṣaṇalavamuhūrtamātreṇa rājājitaseno yena sodyānabhūmistenopasaṅkrāntaḥ /

original: sa ca nandimitramahāśrāvakastenaivopasaṅkrānto rājānamajitasenamevamāha /
analyzed: sa ca nandimitra mahāśrāvakaḥ tena eva upasaṅkrāntaḥ rājānam ajitasenam evam āha
translated: And that great disciple Nandimitra, having approached, said this to King Ajitasena:

translated: Great king, on this piece of land, you should have my hut built, where, seated, I will enjoy my alms-food in your house.

original: nandimitra āha /
analyzed: nandimitraḥ āha
translated: Nandimitra said,

analyzed: yādṛśāḥ tava mahā rāja mahā citta utpāda śraddhā prasādāḥ tādṛśam kuṭikam kāraya
translated: Your Majesty, have a hut built that is equal to your great resolve, faith, and clarity.

original: atha rājā ajitaseno jyeṣṭhāmātyamevamāha /
analyzed: atha rājā ajitasenaḥ jyeṣṭha amātyam evam āha
translated: Then King Ajitasena said to his chief minister,

analyzed: asmin eva pṛthivī pradeśe kuṭikam kāraya

translated: Then the chief minister said to the king,

analyzed: kīdṛśam mahā rāja kuṭikam kārayāmi
translated: Your Majesty, what kind of hut should I build?

analyzed: rājā ajitasenaḥ evam āha

original: atha so 'mātyaḥ kuṭikaṃ kārayati /

translated: Then the minister had a hut built,

original: saptaratnamayaṃ Asv
analyzed: sapta ratna mayam
translated: made of the seven precious substances,

analyzed: maṇi mukti sañchāditam kārayitvā yena rājā ajitasenaḥ tena upasaṅkrāntaḥ rājānam ajitasenam evam āha
translated: covered with jewels and pearls. Having had it built, he approached King Ajitasena and said,

original: kṛtaṃ mahārāja mayā kuṭikaṃ yādṛśamājñaptam /
analyzed: kṛtam mahā rāja mayā kuṭikam yādṛśam ājñaptam
translated: Your Majesty, I have built the hut as instructed.

original: rājā āha /
analyzed: rājā āha
translated: The king said,

analyzed: tatra eva pṛthivī pradeśe caṅkramaḥ kārayitavyaḥ catur yojanāni dīrgheṇa dve yojane vistāreṇa
translated: Right there on that piece of land, have a walking path built, four yojanas long and two yojanas wide.

original: atha so 'mātyastaṃ caṅkramaṃ kārayitvā yena rājā ajitasenastenopasaṅkrānto rājānaṃ gāthābhiradhyabhāṣata /

translated: Then that minister, having had that promenade made, approached King Ajitasena and spoke to the king in verse:
