analyzed: prakṛtim śubha aśubham vimocaye sarvam etat
translated: It will liberate beings from their natural good and bad states, and liberate all living beings from this.

original: aho sulabdhā praṇidhīkṛtaṃ tvayā vimocayī sarvajagat sadevakam /
analyzed: aho su labdhā praṇidhīkṛtam tvayā sarva jagat sa devakam
translated: Ah! You have made an excellent aspiration. You will liberate the entire world, including the gods.

original: praṇidhiṃ kṛtaṃ yattvayamīdṛśaṃ bhave dharmaṃ prakāśeti me dharmabhāṇako //
analyzed: praṇidhim kṛtam yat tu ayam īdṛśam bhave dharmam prakāśa iti me dharma bhāṇakaḥ
translated: You have made such an aspiration: 'May I become a Dharma teacher who proclaims the Dharma.'

original: niṣaṇṇa sthitvā kuṭikā ca caṅkrame ājñā kṛtaṃ yat tvaya yādṛśī kṛtā /
analyzed: niṣaṇṇa sthitvā kuṭikā ca caṅkrame ājñā kṛtam yat yādṛśī kṛtā
translated: Sitting, standing, in the hut, and in the promenade, you have done as commanded.

original: sa caṅkramaṃ caiva kṛtaṃ suśobhanaṃ maṇiratnasañcchādita taṃ ca bhūmim //
analyzed: sa caṅkramam ca eva kṛtam su śobhanam tam ca bhūmim
translated: That promenade is very beautiful, and the ground is covered with precious jewels.

original: atha rājā ajitaseno yena svakā rājadhānī tenopasaṅkrāntaḥ /
analyzed: atha rājā ajitasenaḥ yena svakā rājadhānī tena upasaṅkrāntaḥ
translated: Then King Ajitasena returned to his own capital.

original: atha nandimitramahāśrāvakaḥ pratinivṛtya tatraiva Asv
analyzed: atha nandimitra mahāśrāvakaḥ pratinivṛtya tatra eva
translated: Then the great disciple Nandimitra, having turned back, remained right there,🔽and the king, having entered his own capital,

original: kuṭike niṣaṇṇo vikiraṇaṃ nāma bodhisattvasamādhiṃ samāpanno 'bhūt /
analyzed: kuṭike niṣaṇṇaḥ vikiraṇam nāma bodhisattva samādhim samāpannaḥ bhūt
translated: Seated in the hut, he entered the bodhisattva samādhi called Scattering.

original: anyena keśānanyena nayānānyanyena dantānanyena grīvā anyena bāhū anyena hṛdayamanyenodaramanyenorū anyena jaṅghe anyena pādau samāpanno 'bhūt
analyzed: anyena keśān anyena nayānāni anyena dantān anyena grīvāḥ anyena bāhū anyena hṛdayam anyena udaram anyena ūrū anyena jaṅghe anyena pādau samāpannaḥ bhūt
translated: With one [part of his body] he cut off his hair, with another his nails, with another his teeth, with another his neck, with another his arms, with another his heart, with another his belly, with another his thighs, with another his calves, and with another his feet.

original: atha sa rājā ajitasenaḥ saptāhasyātyayena taṃ bhikṣuṃ na paśyati /
analyzed: atha sa rājā ajitasenaḥ saptāhasya atyayena tam bhikṣum na paśyati
translated: Then, after seven days had passed, King Ajitasena did not see that bhikṣu.

original: atha rājā jyeṣṭhakumāramevamāha /
analyzed: atha rājā jyeṣṭha kumāram evam āha
translated: Then the king said to his eldest son:

original: āgaccha kulaputra gamiṣyāmi tāṃ kuṭikām /
analyzed: āgaccha kula putra gamiṣyāmi tām kuṭikām
translated: Come, son of noble family, let us go to that hut.

original: yena sa bhikṣustenopasaṅkramiṣyāmi /
analyzed: yena sa bhikṣuḥ tena upasaṅkramiṣyāmi
translated: We will approach where that bhikṣu is.

original: atha sa rājā saputro yena sā kuṭikā tenopasaṅkrānto 'bhūt /
analyzed: atha sa rājā sa putraḥ yena sā kuṭikā tena upasaṅkrāntaḥ bhūt
translated: Then the king, together with his son, approached that hut.

original: atha sa rājā ajitasenastaṃ bhikṣumātmabhāvaṃ khaṇḍaṃ khaṇḍaṃ kṛtaṃ dṛṣṭvā saṃśayajāto 'bhūt /🔽santrastaromakūpajāto vastrāṇi pāṭyan paridevan rudan aśrukaṇṭhaḥ putramevamāha /
analyzed: atha sa rājā ajitasenaḥ tam bhikṣum ātmabhāvam khaṇḍam khaṇḍam kṛtam dṛṣṭvā saṃśaya jātaḥ bhūt  santrasta romakūpa jātaḥ vastrāṇi pāṭyan paridevan rudan aśru kaṇṭhaḥ putram evam āha
translated: Then King Ajitasena, seeing that the bhikṣu's body had been cut into pieces, became doubtful.🔽With his hair standing on end in fear, tearing at his clothes, lamenting, crying, his throat choked with tears, he said to his son:

original: ānaya putra tīkṣṇadhāramasim /
analyzed: ānaya putra tīkṣṇa dhāram asim
translated: Bring the sharp sword, son.

original: ātmānaṃ jīvitād vyavaropayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: ātmānam jīvitāt vyavaropayiṣyāmi
translated: I will take my own life.

original: atha sa rājakumāraḥ prāñjaliṃ kṛtvā rājānaṃ gāthābhiradhyabhāṣata /
analyzed: atha sa rāja kumāraḥ prāñjalim kṛtvā rājānam gāthābhiḥ adhyabhāṣata
translated: Then the prince, with folded hands, addressed the king in verses:

original: mā śokacittasya bhave nṛpendra mā vedayī vedanamīdṛśāni /
analyzed: mā śoka cittasya bhave nṛpa indra mā vedayī vedanam īdṛśāni
translated: Do not have a sorrowful mind, O lord of men, do not experience such feelings.

original: ātmaghātaṃ karitvā tu niraye tvaṃ gamiṣyasi /
analyzed: ātma ghātam karitvā tu niraye tvam gamiṣyasi
translated: Having committed suicide, you will go to hell.

original: rauravaṃ narakaṃ cāpi gamiṣyasi sudāruṇam //
analyzed: rauravam narakam ca api gamiṣyasi su dāruṇam
translated: And you will go to the terrible Raurava hell.

original: dakṣiṇīyo ayaṃ loke jaravyādhipramocakaḥ / Asv
analyzed: dakṣiṇīyaḥ ayam loke jara vyādhi pramocakaḥ
translated: He is worthy of offerings in the world, the liberator from old age and disease.

original: na cāyaṃ ghātito yakṣairna bhūtairna ca rākṣasaiḥ /
analyzed: na ca ayam ghātitaḥ yakṣaiḥ na bhūtaiḥ na ca rākṣasaiḥ
translated: And he was not killed by yakshas, spirits, or rakshasas.

original: bodhisattvo 'pyayaṃ loke jaravyādhipramocakaḥ //
analyzed: bodhisattvaḥ pi ayam loke jara vyādhi pramocakaḥ
translated: He is a bodhisattva in the world, the liberator from old age and disease.

original: dakṣiṇīyo ayaṃ loke jaravyādhipramocakaḥ /
analyzed: dakṣiṇīyaḥ ayam loke jara vyādhi pramocakaḥ
translated: He is worthy of offerings in the world, the liberator from old age and disease.

original: durlabho darśanam asya bodhimārgasya darśakaḥ //
analyzed: durlabhaḥ darśanam asya bodhi mārgasya darśakaḥ
translated: Rare is the sight of him, the teacher of the path to enlightenment.

original: kalyāṇamitramayam āsī tava kāraṇamāgatam /
analyzed: kalyāṇa mitra mayam āsīt tava kāraṇam āgatam
translated: He is your good friend, he has come for your sake.

original: dakṣiṇīyo ayaṃ loke sarvasattvasukhāvaham //
analyzed: dakṣiṇīyaḥ ayam loke sarva sattva sukha āvaham
translated: He is worthy of offerings in the world, the bringer of happiness to all beings.

original: sarvajñaṃ pāramiprāptaṃ lokanāthena preṣitam /
analyzed: sarvajñam pārami prāptam lokanāthena preṣitam
translated: The omniscient one, who has reached perfection, sent by the Lord of the World,

original: dṛḍhavīryaṃ dṛḍhasthāmaṃ lokanāthaṃ maharṣiṇam //
analyzed: dṛḍha vīryam dṛḍha sthāmam loka nātham mahā ṛṣiṇam
translated: The one with firm diligence, firm strength, the Lord of the World, the great sage.

original: yo nāma tasya dhāreti nāsau gacchati durgatim /
analyzed: yaḥ nāma tasya dhārā iti na asau gacchati durgatim
translated: Whoever bears his name does not go to a bad rebirth.

original: apāyaṃ na gamiṣyanti svargalokopapattaye //
analyzed: apāyam na gamiṣyanti svarga loka upapattaye
translated: They will not go to the lower realms, but will be reborn in the heavenly worlds.

original: atha sa rājakumārastaṃ pitaraṃ gāthā bhāṣitvā tūṣṇīṃ sthito 'bhūt /
analyzed: atha sa rāja kumāraḥ tam pitaram gāthāḥ bhāṣitvā tūṣṇīm sthitaḥ bhūt
translated: Then the prince, having spoken that verse to his father, remained silent.

original: atha rājā ajitasenaḥ svakaṃ putramevamāha /
analyzed: atha rājā ajitasenaḥ svakam putram evam āha
translated: Then King Ajitasena said to his own son:

original: kathaṃ tvaṃ kumāra jānīṣe yadayaṃ bhikṣuḥ samādhiṃ samāpanno 'bhūt /
analyzed: katham tvam kumāra jānīṣe yat ayam bhikṣuḥ samādhim samāpannaḥ bhūt
translated: How do you know, prince, that this monk has entered into meditation?

original: atha sa rājakumāra evamāha /
analyzed: atha sa rāja kumāraḥ evam āha
translated: Then the prince said:

original: paśya mahārāja ayaṃ bhikṣurbodhisattvasamādhiṃ samāpannaḥ sarvakleśavinirmukto bhavasāgarapāraṅgataḥ sarvasattvahitārthaṃ ca mārgaṃ darśayate
analyzed: paśya mahā rāja ayam bhikṣuḥ bodhisattva samādhim samāpannaḥ sarva kleśa vinirmuktaḥ bhava sāgara pāraṅgataḥ sarva sattva hita artham ca mārgam darśayate  /
translated: Look, Your Majesty, this monk has entered the bodhisattva's meditation, is completely free from afflictions, has gone beyond the ocean of existence, and shows the path for the benefit of all beings.

original: śubham /
analyzed: śubham
translated: The auspicious one.

original: atha sa rājakumāro rājānamevamāha /
analyzed: atha sa rāja kumāraḥ rājānam evam āha
translated: Then the prince said to the king:

original: āgaccha tāta caṅkramaṃ gamiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: āgaccha tāta caṅkramam gamiṣyāmaḥ
translated: Come, Father, let us go for a walk.

original: atha sa rājā sa ca rājakumāro bahubhirdārakaśataiḥ sārdhaṃ yena sa caṅkramastenopasaṅkrāntau /
analyzed: atha sa rājā sa ca rāja kumāraḥ bahubhiḥ dāraka śataiḥ sārdham yena sa caṅkramaḥ tena upasaṅkrāntau
translated: Then the king and the prince, together with many hundreds of boys, went to that walking path.

original: atha sa bhikṣustataḥ samādhervyutthito rājānamajitasenamevamāha /
analyzed: atha sa bhikṣuḥ tatas samādheḥ vyutthitaḥ rājānam ajitasenam evam āha
translated: Then the monk, having arisen from that meditation, said this to King Ajitasena:

original: āgaccha mahārāja kiṃ karoṣyasmin sthāne / Asv
analyzed: āgaccha mahā rāja kim karoṣi asmin sthāne
translated: Come, Your Majesty, what are you doing in this place?

original: atha rājā taṃ bhikṣū dṛṣṭvā maulipaṭṭaṃ rājakumārasya dadāti /
analyzed: atha rājā tam bhikṣū dṛṣṭvā mauli paṭṭam rāja kumārasya dadāti
translated: Then the king, seeing that monk, gave the turban to the prince, saying:

original: tava rājyaṃ bhavatu /
analyzed: tava rājyam bhavatu
translated: May you have the kingdom.

original: dharmeṇa pālaye nādharmeṇa /
analyzed: dharmeṇa pālaye na adharmeṇa
translated: Rule righteously, not unrighteously.

original: rājakumāra āha /
analyzed: rāja kumāraḥ āha
translated: The prince said:

original: bahūnyasaṅkhyeyāni rājakāryāṇi mayā kṛtāni /
analyzed: bahūni asaṅkhyeyāni rāja kāryāṇi mayā kṛtāni
translated: I have done many countless royal duties,

original: na ca kadācittṛptirāsīt /
analyzed: na ca kadācid tṛptiḥ āsīt
translated: but I have never been satisfied.

original: tava tāta rājyaṃ bhavatu /
analyzed: tava tāta rājyam bhavatu
translated: Father, may you have the kingdom.

original: na mama rājyena kāryaṃ na bhogena naiśvaryādhipatyena kāryam /
analyzed: na mama rājyena kāryam na bhogena na aiśvarya ādhipatyena kāryam
translated: I have no need for the kingdom, nor for wealth, nor for lordship.

original: tava rājyaṃ bhavatu tāta /
analyzed: tava rājyam bhavatu tāta
translated: Father, may you have the kingdom.

original: dharmeṇa pālaye nādharmeṇeti /
analyzed: dharmeṇa pālaye na adharmeṇa iti
translated: Rule righteously, not unrighteously.

original: atha rājā yena sa bhikṣustenopasaṅkrāntaḥ prāñjalirevamāha /
analyzed: atha rājā yena sa bhikṣuḥ tena upasaṅkrāntaḥ prāñjaliḥ evam āha
translated: Then the king approached that monk and with folded hands said this:

original: sudurlabhaṃ darśanatubhyamārṣāḥ kṛtāñjaliḥ samabhimukhī nāyakānām /
analyzed: su durlabham darśana tubhyam ārṣāḥ kṛtāñjaliḥ samabhimukhī nāyakānām
translated: It is very difficult to see you, O Sage, with joined palms facing the leaders.

original: mokṣāgamaṃ darśanu tubhyamārṣāḥ sudurlabhaṃ karmaśatairacintiyaiḥ //
analyzed: mokṣa āgamam tubhyam ārṣāḥ su durlabham karma śataiḥ acintiyaiḥ
translated: Seeing you, O Sage, who leads to liberation, is very difficult with countless hundreds of actions.

original: ye darśanaṃ dāsyati tubhyamārṣā muktā ca so bheṣyati kalpakoṭibhiḥ /
analyzed: ye darśanam dāsyati tubhyam ārṣāḥ muktā ca saḥ kalpa koṭibhiḥ
translated: Whoever, O Sage, will give you alms, he will be liberated for millions of eons.

original: na jātu gacche vinipātadurgatiṃ yo nāmadheyaṃ śṛṇute muhūrtam //
analyzed: na jātu gacche vinipāta durgatim yaḥ nāmadheyam śṛṇute muhūrtam
translated: He will never go to the lower realms of downfall, who for a moment hears your name.

original: rājā āha /
analyzed: rājā āha
translated: The king said:🔽O Sage, I have seen you, who are difficult to see, and have heard your name, which is difficult to hear.🔽I have no need for the kingdom, nor for wealth, nor for lordship.

original: niṣadya yugye ratanāmaye śubhe vrajāmyahaṃ yena sa rājadhānīm /
analyzed: niṣadya yugye rata nāmaye śubhe vrajāmi aham yena sa rājadhānīm
translated: Having sat down in the beautiful jeweled chariot, I will go to the royal palace.

original: dadāmyahaṃ bhojanu suprabhūtaṃ dadāmyahaṃ kāśikavastrametat / Asv
analyzed: dadāmi aham su prabhūtam dadāmi aham kāśika vastram etat
translated: I will give you abundant food, and this Kāśika cloth,

original: sūkṣmāṇi jālāni ca saṃhitāni yāṃ cīvarāṃ tubhya dadāmi adya //
analyzed: sūkṣmāṇi jālāni ca saṃhitāni yām dadāmi adya
translated: The fine and woven nets, and the robes I give to you today.

original: atha sa bhikṣū ratnamaye yugye gṛhītvā yena rājadhānī tenopasaṅkrāntaḥ /
analyzed: atha sa bhikṣuḥ ratna maye yugye gṛhītvā yena rājadhānī tena upasaṅkrāntaḥ
translated: Then the monk, having taken the jeweled chariot, went to the royal palace.

original: santarpito bhojanena /
analyzed: santarpitaḥ bhojanena
translated: He was satisfied with food.

original: atha nandimitramahāśrāvako rājānamajitasenaṃ gāthābhiradhyabhāṣata /
analyzed: atha nandimitra mahāśrāvakaḥ rājānam ajitasenam gāthābhiḥ adhyabhāṣata
translated: Then the great disciple Nandimitra spoke these verses to King Ajitasena:

original: santarpito bhojana suprabhūtaṃ mṛṣṭānnapānarasamuttamaṃ śubham /
analyzed: santarpitaḥ bhojana su prabhūtam mṛṣṭa anna pāna rasam uttamam śubham
translated: You are satisfied with abundant food, with delicious, excellent, and pure food and drink.

original: ye bhikṣusaṅghāya dadanti dānaṃ te bodhimaṇḍena cireṇa gacchata //
analyzed: ye bhikṣu saṅghāya dadanti dānam te bodhimaṇḍena cireṇa gacchata
translated: Those who give alms to the assembly of monks will soon go to the seat of enlightenment.

original: sudurlabhaṃ darśana nāyakasya na cireṇa so gacchati buddhakṣetram /
analyzed: su durlabham darśana nāyakasya na cireṇa saḥ gacchati buddhakṣetram
translated: It is difficult to see the leader. He will soon go to the Buddha-field.

original: amitāyuṣasya varabuddhakṣetre sukhāvatīṃ gacchati śīghrametat //
analyzed: amita āyuṣasya vara buddhakṣetre sukhāvatīm gacchati śīghram etat
translated: In the excellent Buddha-field of Amitāyus, he will quickly go to Sukhāvatī.

original: atha nandimitramahāśrāvakaḥ ajitasenasya rājño gāthā bhāṣitvā tūṣṇīṃ sthito 'bhūt /
analyzed: atha nandimitra mahāśrāvakaḥ ajitasenasya rājñaḥ gāthāḥ bhāṣitvā tūṣṇīm sthitaḥ bhūt
translated: Then the great disciple Nandimitra, having spoken these verses to King Ajitasena, remained silent.

original: atha rājā ajitaseno bherīṃ parāhanti sma /
analyzed: atha rājā ajitasenaḥ bherīm parāhanti sma
translated: Then King Ajitasena struck the drum.

original: atha tena bherīśabdena sarvāstā amātyakoṭyo rājānamevamāhuḥ /
analyzed: atha tena bherī śabdena sarvāḥ tāḥ amātya koṭyaḥ rājānam evam āhuḥ
translated: Then, by the sound of that drum, all those millions of ministers said to the king:

original: kasyārthe mahārāja bherī parāhatā /
analyzed: kasya arthe mahā rāja bherī parāhatā
translated: For what purpose, great king, did you strike the drum?

original: rājā āha /
analyzed: rājā āha
translated: The king said:

original: saptame divase hastirathamaśvarathaṃ sajjaṃ kṛtaṃ syāt /🔽ahaṃ saptame divase jetavanaṃ nāma vihāraṃ gamiṣyāmi śākyamunestathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksambuddhasya darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya dharmaśravaṇāya
analyzed: saptame divase hasti ratham aśva ratham sajjam kṛtam syāt  aham saptame divase jetavanam nāma vihāram gamiṣyāmi śākyamuneḥ tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksambuddhasya darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya dharma śravaṇāya
translated: On the seventh day, let the elephant chariot and horse chariot be made ready.

original: Asv /
analyzed: asu
translated: On the seventh day, I will go to the monastery called Jetavana to see the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One Shakyamuni, to pay homage, to serve, and to listen to the Dharma.

original: athāmātyakoṭyastaṃ rājānamajitasenamevamāhuḥ /
analyzed: atha amātya koṭyaḥ tam rājānam ajitasenam evam āhuḥ
translated: Then the millions of ministers said to King Ajitasena:

original: kṛtamasmābhiḥ mahārāja hastirathamaśvarathaṃ sajjam /
analyzed: kṛtam asmābhiḥ mahā rāja hasti ratham aśva ratham sajjam
translated: Great king, we have made the elephant chariot and horse chariot ready.

original: atha rājā ajitaseno hastirathe avaruhya taṃ ca nandimitramahāśrāvakaṃ ratnamaye rathe avarohya yena jetavanaṃ vihārastenopasaṅkrāntaḥ /
analyzed: atha rājā ajitasenaḥ hasti rathe avaruhya tam ca nandimitra mahāśrāvakam ratna maye rathe avarohya yena jetavanam vihāraḥ tena upasaṅkrāntaḥ
translated: Then King Ajitasena descended from the elephant chariot and, having made that great disciple Nandimitra descend from the jeweled chariot, he approached the monastery called Jetavana.

original: atha bhagavān rājānamajitasenaṃ dūrata evāgacchantaṃ dṛṣṭvā tān sarvaśrāvakānāmantrayata /
analyzed: atha bhagavān rājānam ajitasenam dūratas eva āgacchantam dṛṣṭvā tān sarva śrāvakān āmantrayata
translated: Then the Blessed One, seeing King Ajitasena coming from afar, addressed all his disciples:

original: sarvairnānāṛddhivikurvitaṃ darśayitavyam /
analyzed: sarvaiḥ nānā ṛddhi vikurvitam darśayitavyam
translated: All of them should display various supernatural powers and transformations.

original: atha te sarve mahāśrāvakā jvālāmālaṃ nāma bodhisattvasamādhiṃ samāpannā abhūvan /
analyzed: atha te sarve mahāśrāvakāḥ jvālā mālam nāma bodhisattva samādhim samāpannāḥ abhūvan
translated: Then all those great hearers entered the bodhisattva concentration called Garland of Flames.

original: atha rājā dūratastaṃ jvālāmālaṃ dṛṣṭvā nandimitramahāśrāvakamevamāha /
analyzed: atha rājā dūratas tam jvālā mālam dṛṣṭvā nandimitra mahāśrāvakam evam āha
translated: Then, seeing that garland of flames from afar, King Ajitasena said to the great hearer Nandimitra:

original: kasyārthe imaṃ parvataṃ jvālāmālībhūtaṃ paśyāmi /
analyzed: kasya arthe imam parvatam jvālā mālībhūtam paśyāmi
translated: For what purpose do I see this mountain become a garland of flames?

original: nandimitra āha /
analyzed: nandimitraḥ āha
translated: Nandimitra said:

original: atra śākyamunistathāgato 'rhan samyaksambuddhaḥ sthitiṃ dhriyate yāpayati dharmaṃ ca deśayati /
analyzed: atra śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksambuddhaḥ sthitim dhriyate yāpayati dharmam ca deśayati
translated: Here, the Tathagata Shakyamuni, the Arhat, the Fully Enlightened One, abides, endures, and teaches the Dharma.

original: te ca bodhisattvā jvālāmālaṃ nāma bodhisattvasamādhiṃ samāpannāḥ /
analyzed: te ca bodhisattvāḥ jvālā mālam nāma bodhisattva samādhim samāpannāḥ
translated: And those bodhisattvas have entered the bodhisattva concentration called 'Garland of Flames.'

original: atha rājā ajitaseno hastirathādavatīrya pādābhyāṃ putrasahasreṇa sārdhaṃ yena bhagavāṃstenopasaṅkrāntaḥ /
analyzed: atha rājā ajitasenaḥ hasti rathāt avatīrya pādābhyām putra sahasreṇa sārdham yena bhagavān tena upasaṅkrāntaḥ
translated: Then King Ajitasena, having descended from his elephant chariot, approached the Blessed One on foot together with his thousand sons.

original: atha bhagavān suvarṇavarṇena kāyena vyāmaprabhayā caṅkramate sma /
analyzed: atha bhagavān suvarṇa varṇena kāyena vyāma prabhayā caṅkramate sma
translated: Then the Blessed One was walking with a golden-colored body and a radiance of one fathom.

original: atha rājā ajitaseno bhagavato rūpavarṇaliṅgasaṃsthānaṃ dṛṣṭvā mūrcchitvā dharaṇitale nipatitaḥ /
analyzed: atha rājā ajitasenaḥ bhagavataḥ rūpa varṇa liṅga saṃsthānam dṛṣṭvā mūrcchitvā dharaṇi tale nipatitaḥ
translated: Then King Ajitasena, seeing the Blessed One's form, complexion, marks, and figure, fainted and fell to the ground.

original: atha bhagavān suvarṇavarṇaṃ bāhuṃ prasārya taṃ rājānamutthāpayati sma /
analyzed: atha bhagavān suvarṇa varṇam bāhum prasārya tam rājānam utthāpayati sma
translated: Then the Blessed One extended his golden-colored arm and raised the king up.

original: uttiṣṭha mahārāja kasyārthe prapatitaḥ / rājā āha / Asv
analyzed: uttiṣṭha mahā rāja kasya arthe prapatitaḥ rājā āha asu
translated: Rise, great king, for whose sake have you fallen? The king said:

original: bahūni kalpāni acintiyāni jātīśatākoṭi acintiyāni /
analyzed: bahūni kalpāni acintiyāni acintiyāni
translated: For many incalculable eons, for many hundreds of thousands of inconceivable births,

original: na me kadācidiha dṛṣṭarūpaṃ tvaṃ lokanātho varadakṣiṇīyo //
analyzed: na me kadācid iha dṛṣṭa rūpam tvam loka nāthaḥ
translated: I have never seen your form, O Lord of the World, the most worthy of offerings.

original: tvaṃ sārthavāha jaravyādhimocakaṃ suvarṇavarṇaṃ varalakṣaṇāṅgam /
analyzed: tvam sārthavāha jaravyādhi mocakam suvarṇa varṇam vara lakṣaṇa aṅgam
translated: You, the leader of the caravan, the liberator from old age, disease, and death, golden-colored, with limbs marked by excellent signs,

original: dvātṛṃśatā lakṣaṇadhāriṇaṃ mune nāsau kadācidvrajate apāyabhūmim /
analyzed: dvātṛṃśatā lakṣaṇa dhāriṇam mune na asau kadācid vrajate apāya bhūmim
translated: O Sage, the bearer of the thirty-two marks, he never goes to the lower realms.

original: yo lokanāthasya hi rūpu paśye tvaṃ lokanāthā śirasā namasyāmī //
analyzed: yaḥ loka nāthasya hi rūpu paśye tvam loka nāthā śirasā
translated: Whoever sees the form of the Lord of the World, I, the Lord of the World, bow my head in homage.

original: atha rājā ajitasenaḥ kṛtāñjaliḥ bhagavantamevamāha /
analyzed: atha rājā ajitasenaḥ kṛtāñjaliḥ bhagavantam evam āha
translated: Then King Ajitasena, with palms joined, said to the Blessed One:

original: ahaṃ bhagavan tava śāsane pravrajiṣyāmi /
analyzed: aham bhagavan tava śāsane pravrajiṣyāmi
translated: Blessed One, I will go forth in your teaching.

original: atha bhagavān tuṣṭa udagra āttamanāḥ pramuditaḥ prītisaumanasyajātaḥ /
analyzed: atha bhagavān tuṣṭaḥ udagraḥ ātta manāḥ pramuditaḥ prīti saumanasya jātaḥ
translated: Then the Blessed One, delighted, elated, joyful, and blissful,

original: alabdhalābhā ye tatra mama śāsanaṃ vaistārikaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: alabdha lābhāḥ ye tatra mama śāsanam vaistārikam bhavati
translated: said: Those who have not attained the attainment, for whom my teaching will spread,

original: taṃ rājānamajitasenamevamāha /
analyzed: tam rājānam ajitasenam evam āha
translated: he said to King Ajitasena:

original: gaccha tvaṃ mahārāja svagṛhe saptame divase āgamiṣyāmi /
analyzed: gaccha tvam mahā rāja sva gṛhe saptame divase āgamiṣyāmi
translated: Go, great king, and on the seventh day I will come to your house.

original: atha rājā ajitasenastuṣṭa udagra āttamanāḥ pramuditaḥ prītisaumanasyajātastaṃ kalyāṇamitraṃ bhikṣuṃ purataḥsthāpya svagṛhaṃ gatvā sarvānamātyānāmantrayate
analyzed: atha rājā ajitasenaḥ tuṣṭaḥ udagraḥ ātta manāḥ pramuditaḥ prīti saumanasya jātaḥ tam kalyāṇa mitram bhikṣum puratas sthāpya sva gṛham gatvā sarvān amātyān āmantrayate  /
translated: Then King Ajitasena, delighted, elated, joyful, and overjoyed, with a mind full of joy and happiness, having placed that good friend, the monk, in front of him, went to his own house and addressed all his ministers, saying:

original: sma /
analyzed: sma
translated: He said, Tomorrow, on the seventh day, the monk will come to my house.

original: sarvairgrāmanagaranigamajanapadaiḥ pathaṃ śodhayitavyaṃ gṛhe gṛhe dhvajānyucchrāpitavyāni gṛhe gṛhe ratnamayāni Asv 🔽kumbhāni paripūrayitavyāni /
analyzed: sarvaiḥ grāma nagara nigama janapadaiḥ patham śodhayitavyam gṛhe gṛhe dhvajāni ucchrāpitavyāni gṛhe gṛhe ratna mayāni  kumbhāni paripūrayitavyāni
translated: All of you, in all the villages, towns, markets, and countries, should clear the road, hoist flags in every house, and fill jeweled jars in every house.

original: tadā taiḥ sarvairamātyairājñātam /
analyzed: tadā taiḥ sarvaiḥ amātyaiḥ ājñātam
translated: Then all the ministers were informed.

original: sarvagrāmanagaranigamajanapadaiḥ pathaṃ śodhitaṃ dhvajānyucchrāpitāni ratnamayāni kumbhāni paripūritāni /
analyzed: sarva grāma nagara nigama janapadaiḥ patham śodhitam dhvajāni ucchrāpitāni ratna mayāni kumbhāni paripūritāni
translated: In all the villages, towns, markets, and countries, the road was cleared, flags were hoisted, and jeweled jars were filled.

original: yatra rājā ajitasenaḥ prativasati tatra dvādaśakoṭyo dhvajānāmucchrāpitā dvādaśakoṭyo ratnamayānāṃ kumbhānāṃ paripūritāḥ /
analyzed: yatra rājā ajitasenaḥ prativasati tatra dvādaśa koṭyaḥ dhvajānām ucchrāpitāḥ dvādaśa koṭyaḥ ratna mayānām kumbhānām paripūritāḥ
translated: Where King Ajitasena resided, there twelve koṭis of flags were hoisted and twelve koṭis of jeweled jars were filled.

original: yāvat saptame divase tathāgato 'rhan samyaksambuddhaḥ śāriputramaudgalyāyanānandapūrṇamaitrāyaṇīputrapramukhairmahāśrāvakasaṅghaiḥ
analyzed: yāvat saptame divase tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksambuddhaḥ śāriputra maudgalyāyana ānanda pūrṇa maitrāyaṇīputra pramukhaiḥ mahāśrāvaka saṅghaiḥ
translated: On the seventh day, the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, surrounded and revered by a great assembly of great disciples headed by Shariputra, Maudgalyayana, Ananda, Purna, and Maitrayaniputra,

original: parivṛtaḥ puraskṛtaḥ ajitasenasya rājño rājadhānīmanuprāptaḥ /
analyzed: parivṛtaḥ puraskṛtaḥ ajitasenasya rājñaḥ rājadhānīm anuprāptaḥ
translated: arrived at the capital of King Ajitasena.

original: atha rājā ajitasenaḥ puṣpapiṭakaṃ gṛhītvā kalyāṇamitraṃ purataḥsthāpya bhagavantaṃ puṣpairavakiran bhagavantamevamāha /
analyzed: atha rājā ajitasenaḥ puṣpa piṭakam gṛhītvā kalyāṇamitram puratas sthāpya bhagavantam puṣpaiḥ avakiran bhagavantam evam āha
translated: Then King Ajitasena, taking a basket of flowers, placing a good friend in front, scattering flowers on the Blessed One, said to the Blessed One:

original: anena kuśalamūlena sarvasattvā anuttarāṃ samyaksambodhimabhisampadyante /
analyzed: anena kuśala mūlena sarva sattvāḥ anuttarām samyaksambodhim abhisampadyante
translated: By this root of merit, may all beings attain supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: atha rājñā ajitasenena āsanāni prajñaptāni /
analyzed: atha rājñā ajitasenena āsanāni prajñaptāni
translated: Then seats were arranged by King Ajitasena.

original: tasya bhagavataḥ siṃhāsanaṃ pradattam /
analyzed: tasya bhagavataḥ siṃhāsanam pradattam
translated: A lion throne was offered to the Blessed One.

original: atha bhagavān siṃhāsane niṣaṇṇo rājño 'jitasenasya dharmān deśitavān /
analyzed: atha bhagavān siṃhāsane niṣaṇṇaḥ rājñaḥ jitasenasya dharmān deśitavān
translated: Then the Blessed One, seated on the lion throne, taught the Dharma to King Ajitasena.

original: atha rājñā ajitasenena prabhūtenāhāreṇa khādanīyena bhojanīyena santarpitaḥ /
analyzed: atha rājñā ajitasenena prabhūtena āhāreṇa khādanīyena bhojanīyena santarpitaḥ
translated: Then King Ajitasena satisfied him with abundant food and drink.

original: atha rājā ajitaseno jyeṣṭhakaṃ rājakumāraṃ dadāti /
analyzed: atha rājā ajitasenaḥ jyeṣṭhakam rāja kumāram dadāti
translated: Then King Ajitasena gave his eldest prince,

original: imaṃ rājakumāraṃ pravrājaya /
analyzed: imam rāja kumāram pravrājaya
translated: Ordain this prince.

original: tadahaṃ paścāt pravrajiṣyāmi /
analyzed: tat aham paścāt pravrajiṣyāmi
translated: I will go forth later.

original: atha bhagavānāyuṣmantamānandamāmantrayate sma /
analyzed: atha bhagavān āyuṣmantam ānandam āmantrayate sma
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the Venerable Ānanda:

original: gacchānanda imaṃ rājakumāraṃ pravrājaya /
analyzed: gaccha ānanda imam rāja kumāram pravrājaya
translated: Go, Ānanda, and let this prince go forth.

original: Asv athāyuṣmatānandena sa rājakumāraḥ pravrājitaḥ /
analyzed: asu atha āyuṣmatā ānandena sa rāja kumāraḥ pravrājitaḥ
translated: Then the Venerable Ānanda let that prince go forth.

original: saha pravrajitamātreṇa arhatphalaṃ prāptamabhūt /
analyzed: saha pravrajita mātreṇa arhat phalam prāptam abhūt
translated: As soon as he had gone forth, he attained the fruit of arhatship.

original: sarvabuddhakṣetrāṇi paśyati sma /
analyzed: sarva buddhakṣetrāṇi paśyati sma
translated: He saw all the buddha-fields.

original: atha sa rājakumāro 'ntarīkṣagatastaṃ pitaraṃ gāthābhiradhyabhāṣata /
analyzed: atha sa rāja kumāraḥ ntarīkṣa gataḥ tam pitaram gāthābhiḥ adhyabhāṣata
translated: Then that prince, while in the sky, spoke these verses to his father:

original: mā vilamba kurute tāta mā khedaṃ kiñci yāsyasi /🔽aho sulabdhaṃ sugatāna darśanaṃ aho sulabdhaṃ sugatāna lābham //
analyzed: mā vilamba kurute tāta mā khedam kiñci yāsyasi  aho su labdham sugatāna darśanam aho su labdham sugatāna lābham
translated: Do not delay, father, do not be distressed in any way.🔽Ah, how well-obtained is the vision of the Sugatas! Ah, how well-obtained is the gain of the Sugatas!

original: aho sulabdhaṃ paramaṃ hi lābhaṃ pravrajyalābhaṃ sugatena varṇitam /
analyzed: aho su labdham paramam hi lābham pravrajya lābham sugatena varṇitam
translated: Ah, how well-obtained is the supreme gain, praised by the Sugata as the gain of going forth!

original: saṃsāramokṣo sugatena varṇitaṃ pravrajya śīghraṃ ma vilamba tāta //
analyzed: sugatena varṇitam pravrajya śīghram mā vilamba tāta
translated: The Sugata praises liberation from saṃsāra. Go forth quickly, father, do not delay!

original: mā khedayī lokavināyakendraṃ
analyzed: mā khedayī loka vināyaka indram
translated: Do not distress the lord of the world's guides,

original: sudurlabhaṃ labdha manuṣyalābhaṃ sudurlabhaṃ darśanu nāyakānām /
analyzed: su durlabham manuṣya lābham su durlabham nāyakānām
translated: The gain of a human birth is very difficult to obtain, the sight of the guides is very difficult to obtain,

original: śīghaṃ ca pravrajya mayā hi labdhaṃ prāptaṃ mayā uttamamagrabodhim /
analyzed: śīgham ca pravrajya mayā hi labdham prāptam mayā uttamam agra bodhim
translated: And I quickly went forth, and attained supreme enlightenment.

original: śrutvā na rājā tada putravākyaṃ sa pravrajī śāsani nāyakasya //
analyzed: śrutvā na rājā putra vākyam sa pravrajī śāsani nāyakasya
translated: Having heard these words of his son, the king went forth in the teaching of the Guide.

original: atha rājakumāro 'ntarīkṣagato gāthāṃ bhāṣitvā tūṣṇīṃ sthito 'bhūt /
analyzed: atha rāja kumāraḥ ntarīkṣa gataḥ gāthām bhāṣitvā tūṣṇīm sthitaḥ bhūt
translated: Then the prince, having spoken the verse while in the sky, remained silent.

original: atha rājā ajitasenaḥ putrasya vākyaṃ śrutvā tuṣṭa udagra Asv
analyzed: atha rājā ajitasenaḥ putrasya vākyam śrutvā tuṣṭaḥ udagra
translated: Then King Ajitasena, having heard the words of his son, was pleased, elated,

original: āttamanāḥ pramuditaḥ prītisaumanasyajāto bhagavantamuddiśya vihāraṃ kārayati sma /🔽tūryakoṭyo 'nupradattāḥ /
analyzed: ātta manāḥ pramuditaḥ prīti saumanasya jātaḥ bhagavantam uddiśya vihāram kārayati sma  tūrya koṭyaḥ nupradattāḥ
translated: delighted, and filled with joy and happiness. He had a monastery built for the Blessed One.🔽Ten million musical instruments were offered.

original: antaḥpurasahasramasyāstrīndriyamantarhitapuruṣendriyaṃ prādurabhūt /
analyzed: antaḥpura sahasram asyāḥ tri indriyam antarhita puruṣa indriyam prādurabhūt
translated: His thousand inner quarters disappeared, and the male organ appeared.

original: atha rājā ajitaseno bhagavataḥ śāsane pravrajito 'bhūt /
analyzed: atha rājā ajitasenaḥ bhagavataḥ śāsane pravrajitaḥ bhūt
translated: Then King Ajitasena went forth in the teaching of the Blessed One.

original: tāścāmātyakoṭyo bhagavataḥ śāsane pravrajitā abhūvan /
analyzed: tāḥ ca amātya koṭyaḥ bhagavataḥ śāsane pravrajitāḥ abhūvan
translated: And those ten million ministers went forth in the teaching of the Blessed One.

original: taccāntaḥpurapuruṣasahasraṃ pravrajitamabhūt /
analyzed: tat ca antaḥpura puruṣa sahasram pravrajitam abhūt
translated: And that thousand inner quarters of men went forth.

original: bhagavān rājānamajitasenaṃ pravrājya yena jetavanaṃ vihārastena gamanamārabdhavān /
analyzed: bhagavān rājānam ajitasenam pravrājya yena jetavanam vihāraḥ tena gamanam ārabdhavān
translated: After the Blessed One had caused King Ajitasena to go forth, he set out to go to the Jetavana monastery.

original: athāyuṣmānānando bhagavantamevamāha /
analyzed: atha āyuṣmān ānandaḥ bhagavantam evam āha
translated: Then the Venerable Ānanda said this to the Blessed One:

original: ayaṃ rājā ajitaseno rājyaṃ parityajya vihāraṃ kārayitvā bhagavataḥ śāsane pravrajito 'bhūt /
analyzed: ayam rājā ajitasenaḥ rājyam parityajya vihāram kārayitvā bhagavataḥ śāsane pravrajitaḥ bhūt
translated: This King Ajitasena, having abandoned the kingdom and built a monastery, has gone forth in the Blessed One's teaching.

original: asya kīdṛśaṃ kuśalamūlaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: asya kīdṛśam kuśala mūlam bhaviṣyati
translated: What kind of wholesome root will he have?

original: bhagavānāha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: sādhu sādhu ānanda yattvayā parikīrtitam /
analyzed: sādhu sādhu ānanda yat tvayā parikīrtitam
translated: Good, good, Ānanda, that you have proclaimed this.

original: ayaṃ rājā ajitaseno mama śāsane pravrajito bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: ayam rājā ajitasenaḥ mama śāsane pravrajitaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: This King Ajitasena will go forth in my teaching.

original: anāgate 'dhvanyaparimitaiḥ kalpairacintyairaparimāṇairajitaprabho nāma tathāgato🔽'rhan samyak sambuddho loke bhaviṣyati vidyācaraṇasampannaḥ sugato lokavidanuttaraḥ
analyzed: anāgate dhvanya parimitaiḥ kalpaiḥ acintyaiḥ aparimāṇaiḥ ajitaprabhaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ  rhan samyak sambuddhaḥ loke bhaviṣyati vidyā caraṇa sampannaḥ sugataḥ loka vid anuttaraḥ
translated: In the future, after immeasurable, inconceivable, and immeasurable eons, he will become a Tathāgata, an Arhat, a Perfectly Enlightened One, named Ajita-prabha,

original: puruṣadamyasārathiḥ śāstā devānāṃ ca manuṣyāṇāṃ ca buddho bhagavān /
analyzed: puruṣa damya sārathiḥ śāstā devānām ca manuṣyāṇām ca buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: perfect in knowledge and conduct, a Sugata, a knower of the world, an unsurpassed trainer of those who can be trained, a teacher of gods and humans, a Buddha, a Blessed One.

original: ānanda āha /
analyzed: ānandaḥ āha
translated: Ānanda said:

original: ayaṃ nandimitramahāśrāvako rājñaḥ kalyāṇa mitramabhūt /
analyzed: ayam nandimitra mahāśrāvakaḥ rājñaḥ kalyāṇa mitram abhūt
translated: This great disciple Nandimitra was a good friend of the king.

original: kidṛśaṃ vāsya kuśalamūlaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: kidṛśam vā asya kuśala mūlam bhaviṣyati
translated: What kind of wholesome root will he have?

original: bhagavānāha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: Asv ayamānanda nandimitramahāśrāvakastatraiva kālasamaye nandiprabho nāma tathāgato 'rhan samyaksambuddho loke bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: ayam ānanda nandimitra mahāśrāvakaḥ tatra eva kāla samaye nandiprabhaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksambuddhaḥ loke bhaviṣyati
translated: Ananda, the great disciple Nandimitra will pass away at that very time, and a Tathagata named Nandiprabha will appear in the world, an Arhat, a Fully Enlightened One.

original: ānanda āha /
analyzed: ānandaḥ āha
translated: Ananda said:

original: kīdṛśaṃ bhagavan teṣāṃ tathāgatānāṃ buddhakṣetraṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: kīdṛśam bhagavan teṣām tathāgatānām buddhakṣetram bhaviṣyati
translated: Blessed One, what will be the Buddha-field of those Tathagatas?

original: bhagavānāha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: aparimitaguṇasañcayā nāma sā buddhakṣetraṃ bhaviṣyati yatreme tathāgatā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: aparimitaguṇasañcayā nāma sā buddhakṣetram bhaviṣyati yatra ime tathāgatāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: That Buddha-field will be named Aparimitagunasamcaya, where those Tathagatas will be.

original: ānanda āha /
analyzed: ānandaḥ āha
translated: Ananda said:

original: ya imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ sakalaṃ samāptaṃ paścime kāle paścime samaye samprakāśayiṣyati tasya kīdṛśaḥ puṇyaskandho bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: yaḥ imam dharmaparyāyam sakalam samāptam paścime kāle paścime samaye samprakāśayiṣyati tasya kīdṛśaḥ puṇya skandhaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Blessed One, what will be the merit of one who teaches this Dharma discourse in its entirety in the later times, in the later period?

original: bhagavānāha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: yadā mayānanda duṣkarakoṭiniyutaśatasahasrāṇi caritvā bodhirabhisambuddhā tadā te sattvā bodhimabhisambhotsyante /
analyzed: yadā mayā ānanda duṣkara koṭi niyuta śata sahasrāṇi caritvā bodhiḥ abhisambuddhā tadā te sattvāḥ bodhim abhisambhotsyante
translated: Ananda, when I have practiced for many quintillions of difficult austerities and attained enlightenment, those beings will attain enlightenment.

original: ya etaddharmaparyāyāt catuṣpadikāmapi gāthāṃ śroṣyanti avaivartikāśca te sattvā bhaviṣyantyanuttarāyāṃ samyaksambodhau /
analyzed: ye etad dharmaparyāyāt catuṣpadikām api gāthām śroṣyanti a vaivartikāḥ ca te sattvāḥ bhaviṣyanti anuttarāyām samyaksambodhau
translated: Those beings who will hear even four lines of a verse from this Dharma discourse will become irreversible from supreme and perfect enlightenment.

original: ānanda āha /
analyzed: ānandaḥ āha
translated: Ananda said:

original: ya imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ dharmabhāṇakāḥ samprakāśayiṣyanti teṣāṃ kīdṛśaṃ kuśalamūlaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: ye imam dharmaparyāyam dharma bhāṇakāḥ samprakāśayiṣyanti teṣām kīdṛśam kuśala mūlam bhaviṣyati
translated: What kind of wholesome roots will those Dharma teachers have who will teach this Dharma discourse?

original: bhagavānāha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: śṛṇu ānanda rājā bhaviṣyati cakravartī caturdvīpeśvaraḥ /
analyzed: śṛṇu ānanda rājā bhaviṣyati cakravartī catur dvīpa īśvaraḥ
translated: Listen, Ānanda. That king will become a universal monarch, a lord of the four continents.

original: ya imaṃ dhamaparyāyaṃ sakalaṃ samāptaṃ samprakāśayiṣyanti muktāśca bhaviṣyanti jātijarāvyādhiparidevaduḥkhadaurmanasyopāyāsebhyaḥ parimuktā
analyzed: ye imam dhamaparyāyam sakalam samāptam samprakāśayiṣyanti muktāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti jāti jarā vyādhi parideva duḥkha daurmanasya upāyāsebhyaḥ parimuktā
translated: Those who will teach this Dharma discourse in its entirety will be liberated from birth, old age, sickness, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and agitation.

original: bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will be liberated.

original: ānanda āha /
analyzed: ānandaḥ āha
translated: Ānanda said:

original: ye paścime kāle paścime samaye sattvā imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ pratikṣepsyanti na pattīyiṣyanti teṣāṃ kā gatirbhaviṣyati kaḥ parāyaṇam /
analyzed: ye paścime kāle paścime samaye sattvāḥ imam dharmaparyāyam pratikṣepsyanti na pattīyiṣyanti teṣām kā gatiḥ bhaviṣyati kaḥ parāyaṇam
translated: In the later times, in the later period, those beings who will reject this Dharma discourse and not accept it, what will be their destiny, what their refuge?

original: Asv bhagavānāha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: alamalamānanda /
analyzed: alam alam ānanda
translated: Enough, Ānanda.

original: mā me pāpakaṃ karmaskandhaṃ paripṛccha /
analyzed: mā me pāpakam karma skandham paripṛccha
translated: Do not ask me about the heap of my evil karma.

original: na mayā śakyaṃ parikīrtayitum /
analyzed: na mayā śakyam parikīrtayitum
translated: I am not able to proclaim it.

original: anyatra buddhakoṭibhirnaśakyaṃ parikīrtayitum /
analyzed: anyatra buddha koṭibhiḥ na śakyam parikīrtayitum
translated: Except for the millions of Buddhas, it is not possible to proclaim it.

original: ānanda āha /
analyzed: ānandaḥ āha
translated: Ānanda said:

original: parikīrtaya bhagavan parikīrtaya /
analyzed: parikīrtaya bhagavan parikīrtaya
translated: Proclaim it, Blessed One, proclaim it!

original: sugato bhagavānāha /
analyzed: sugataḥ bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One, the Sugata, said:

original: śruṇu ānanda saddharmapratikṣepakasya gatiṃ parikīrtayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: śruṇu ānanda saddharma pratikṣepakasya gatim parikīrtayiṣyāmi
translated: Listen, Ānanda, I will proclaim the destiny of one who rejects the true Dharma.

original: raurave mahānarake hāhahe mahānarake avīcau mahānarake tiryagyonau yamaloke ca pretaviṣaye bahūni kalpasahasrāṇi duḥkhamanubhavitavyam /
analyzed: raurave mahā narake hāhahe mahā narake avīcau mahā narake tiryagyonau yama loke ca preta viṣaye bahūni kalpa sahasrāṇi duḥkham anubhavitavyam
translated: One must experience suffering for many thousands of eons in the great hell of Raurava, the great hell of Hāhāva, the great Avīci hell, in the animal realm, in the world of Yama, and in the realm of hungry ghosts.

original: yadi kadācinmanuṣyaloke upapatsyate dīrghaśuṣkatālukaṇṭho bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: yadi kadācid manuṣya loke upapatsyate dīrgha śuṣka tālu kaṇṭhaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: If one is born in the human realm at some point, one will have a long, dry palate and throat.

original: dvādaśayojanāni tasya jihvā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: dvādaśa yojanāni tasya jihvā bhaviṣyati
translated: One's tongue will be twelve yojanas long.

original: dvādaśahalyāni pravahiṣyanti ye evaṃ vāgabhāṣiṣyante /
analyzed: dvādaśa halyāni pravahiṣyanti ye evam vāc abhāṣiṣyante
translated: Twelve furrows will be plowed [on it]. Those who speak such words

original: mā bhoḥ kulaputrā bhoḥ kvacit saddharmaṃ pratikṣepaṣyatha /
analyzed: mā bhoḥ kula putrāḥ bhoḥ kvacid saddharmam
translated: should not, O sons of good family, at any time reject the true Dharma.

original: saddharmapratikṣepakasya evaṃ gatirbhavati /
analyzed: saddharma pratikṣepakasya evam gatiḥ bhavati
translated: The destiny of one who rejects the true Dharma is like this.

original: ānanda āha /
analyzed: ānandaḥ āha
translated: Ānanda said:

original: kena hetunā bhagavan saddharmaḥ pratikṣipto bhavati /
analyzed: kena hetunā bhagavan saddharmaḥ pratikṣiptaḥ bhavati
translated: For what reason, Blessed One, is the true Dharma rejected?

original: bhagavānāha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: ye sattvāḥ paścime kāle paścime samaye eteṣāṃ sūtrānudhārakāṇāṃ dharmabhāṇakānāmākrośiṣyanti
analyzed: ye sattvāḥ paścime kāle paścime samaye eteṣām sūtra anudhārakāṇām dharma bhāṇakānām ākrośiṣyanti
translated: Those beings who in the latter time, in the latter five hundred years, will revile those who uphold these sūtras, those Dharma teachers,

original: paribhāṣiṣyante kutsayiṣyanti paṃsayiṣyanti tasya dharmabhāṇakasya duṣṭacittamutpādayiṣyanti🔽tebhyaḥ saddharmaḥ pratikṣipto
analyzed: paribhāṣiṣyante kutsayiṣyanti paṃsayiṣyanti tasya dharma bhāṇakasya duṣṭa cittam utpādayiṣyanti  tebhyaḥ saddharmaḥ pratikṣiptaḥ
translated: They will scold, revile, and insult that Dharma teacher, and will arouse an evil mind towards him.

original: bhaviṣyati /🔽yaḥ sattvaḥ Asv
analyzed: bhaviṣyati  yaḥ sattvaḥ asu
translated: For them, the true Dharma will be rejected.

original: trisāhasramahāsāhasryāṃ lokadhātau sattvānāmakṣīṇyutpāṭayet ayaṃ tato bahutaramapuṇyaskandho bhavet /
analyzed: tri sāhasra mahā sāhasryām lokadhātau sattvānām akṣīṇi utpāṭayet ayam tatas bahutaram apuṇya skandhaḥ bhavet
translated: Whoever in this great trichiliocosm would pluck out the eyes of all beings, the mass of demerit from that would be much greater than the mass of demerit from looking at those who uphold this sūtra with an evil mind.

original: evameva ya eteṣāṃ sūtradhārakāṇāṃ dharmabhāṇakāṇāṃ duṣṭacittaprekṣitā ayaṃ tato bahutaramapuṇyaskandhaṃ prasaviṣyate /
analyzed: evam eva yaḥ eteṣām sūtra dhārakāṇām dharma bhāṇakāṇām duṣṭa citta prekṣitā ayam tatas bahutaram apuṇya skandham prasaviṣyate
translated: In the same way, whoever looks at those who uphold this sūtra with an evil mind will generate a much greater mass of demerit than that.

original: atha ānando bhagavato gāthāḥ pratyabhāṣata /
analyzed: atha ānandaḥ bhagavataḥ gāthāḥ pratyabhāṣata
translated: Then Ānanda spoke these verses to the Blessed One:

original: bahusūtrasahasrāṇi śrutaṃ me śāstusammukhāt /
analyzed: bahu sūtra sahasrāṇi śrutam me śāstu sammukhāt
translated: I have heard many thousands of sūtras directly from the Teacher,

original: na came īdṛśaṃ sūtraṃ śrutapūrvaṃ kadācana //
analyzed: na came īdṛśam sūtram śruta pūrvam kadācana
translated: But I have never before heard a sūtra like this.

original: parinirvṛtasya śāstusya paścātkāle subhairave /
analyzed: parinirvṛtasya śāstusya paścātkāle su bhairave
translated: After the Teacher has passed into parinirvāṇa, in the terrifying future time,

original: idaṃ sūtraṃ prakāśiṣye dhārayiṣye imaṃ nayam //
analyzed: idam sūtram prakāśiṣye dhārayiṣye imam nayam
translated: I will proclaim this sūtra and uphold this teaching.

original: yatra sūtraratne asmiṃ paścātkāle bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: yatra sūtra ratne asmin paścātkāle bhaviṣyati
translated: Wherever this jewel of a sūtra will be in the future time,

original: rakṣāṃ kariṣyāmi teṣāṃ paścātkāle subhairave //
analyzed: rakṣām kariṣyāmi teṣām paścātkāle su bhairave
translated: I will provide protection for them in the terrifying future time.

original: pratikṣipiṣyāmi nedaṃ gambhīraṃ buddhabhāṣitam //
analyzed: pratikṣipiṣyāmi na idam gambhīram buddha bhāṣitam
translated: I will reject this profound teaching of the Buddha.

original: athāyuṣmānānando bhagavato gāthā bhāṣitvā tūṣṇīṃ sthito 'bhūt /
analyzed: atha āyuṣmān ānandaḥ bhagavataḥ gāthāḥ bhāṣitvā tūṣṇīm sthitaḥ bhūt
translated: Then the Venerable Ānanda, having spoken these verses to the Blessed One, remained silent.

original: atha kāśyapo mahāśrāvako bhagavantaṃ gāthābhiradhyabhāṣata /
analyzed: atha kāśyapaḥ mahāśrāvakaḥ bhagavantam gāthābhiḥ adhyabhāṣata
translated: Then the great disciple Kāśyapa addressed the Blessed One in verses:

original: suvarṇavarṇaṃ varalakṣaṇāṅgaṃ dvātriṃśatā lakṣaṇadhāriṇaṃ jinam /
analyzed: suvarṇa varṇam vara lakṣaṇa aṅgam dvātriṃśatā lakṣaṇa dhāriṇam jinam
translated: The one with the golden complexion, the excellent thirty-two marks, the Victor who bears the thirty-two marks,

original: subhāṣitaṃ sūtra mahānubhāvagaṃ gambhīradharmaṃ nipuṇaṃ sudurdṛśam // Asv
analyzed: su bhāṣitam sūtra mahā anubhāvagam gambhīra dharmam nipuṇam su durdṛśam
translated: The well-spoken sūtra of great power, the profound Dharma, subtle and very difficult to see,

original: prakāśitaṃ sūtramidaṃ niruttaraṃ mā paścakāle parinirvṛte jite /
analyzed: prakāśitam sūtram idam niruttaram mā paśca kāle parinirvṛte jite
translated: This unsurpassed sūtra has been revealed. After the Victor's parinirvāṇa,

original: dhāriṣye maṃ sūtranayaṃ niruttaraṃ /
analyzed: dhāriṣye mam sūtra nayam niruttaram
translated: I will uphold this unsurpassed sūtra system.

original: athāyuṣmān śāradvatīputro bhagavantaṃ gāthābhiradhyabhāṣata /
analyzed: atha āyuṣmān śāradvatī putraḥ bhagavantam gāthābhiḥ adhyabhāṣata
translated: Then the Venerable Śāradvatīputra addressed the Blessed One in verses:

original: namo 'stu te buddha mahānubhāva prakāśitaṃ sutramidaṃ niruttaram /
analyzed: namaḥ stu te buddha mahā anubhāva prakāśitam sutram idam niruttaram
translated: Homage to you, O Buddha of great power, this unsurpassed sūtra has been revealed.

original: parinirvṛtasya tava lokanāyakā likhiṣyati sūtrametaṃ niruttaram //
analyzed: parinirvṛtasya tava loka nāyakāḥ likhiṣyati sūtram etam niruttaram
translated: O Guide of the world, when you have passed into parinirvāṇa, someone will write down this unsurpassed sūtra.

original: na cāpi so gacchati durgatībhayaṃ svargaṃ ca so gacchati kṣiprametat //
analyzed: na ca api saḥ gacchati durgatī bhayam svargam ca saḥ gacchati kṣipram etat
translated: And they will not go to the fear of the lower realms, but will quickly go to heaven.

original: athāyuṣmān pūrṇo maitrāyaṇīputro bhagavantaṃ gāthābhiradhyabhāṣata /
analyzed: atha āyuṣmān pūrṇaḥ maitrāyaṇīputraḥ bhagavantam gāthābhiḥ adhyabhāṣata
translated: Then the Venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaṇīputra addressed the Blessed One in verse:

original: kṛtajño bahusattvānāṃ mocako durgatībhayāt /
analyzed: kṛtajñaḥ bahu sattvānām mocakaḥ durgatī bhayāt
translated: You are grateful to many beings, a liberator from the fears of bad destinies.

original: prakāśitaṃ tvayā sūtraṃ gambhīraṃ buddhadakṣiṇam //
analyzed: prakāśitam tvayā sūtram gambhīram buddha dakṣiṇam
translated: You have revealed this sūtra, profound, the Buddha's right-hand side.

original: ahaṃ hi paścime kāle nirvṛte tvayi nāyake /
analyzed: aham hi paścime kāle nirvṛte tvayi nāyake
translated: I, in the latter time, when you, the leader, have passed into Nirvāṇa,

original: idaṃ sūtraṃ prakāśiṣye hitāya sarvaprāṇinām //
analyzed: idam sūtram prakāśiṣye hitāya sarva prāṇinām
translated: I will proclaim this sūtra for the benefit of all living beings.

original: iti /
analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

original: atha brahmā sahāmpatirbhagavantaṃ gāthābhiradhyabhāṣata /
analyzed: atha brahmā sahāmpatiḥ bhagavantam gāthābhiḥ adhyabhāṣata
translated: Then Brahmā, the Lord of the Sahā World, addressed the Blessed One in verse:

original: namo 'stu te buddha mahānubhāvā prakāśitaṃ sūtramidaṃ tvayā śubham / Asv
analyzed: namaḥ stu te buddha mahā anubhāvā prakāśitam sūtram idam tvayā śubham
translated: Homage to you, O Buddha of great power, this auspicious sūtra has been revealed by you.

original: parinirvṛtasya tava lokanāyaka rakṣāṃ kariṣyāmi ha sūtraratne //
analyzed: parinirvṛtasya tava loka nāyaka rakṣām kariṣyāmi ha sūtra ratne
translated: O leader of the world, when you have passed into final Nirvāṇa, I will protect this jewel of a sūtra.

original: atha catvāro mahārājā bhagavantaṃ gāthābhiradhyabhāṣanta /
analyzed: atha catvāraḥ mahā rājāḥ bhagavantam gāthābhiḥ adhyabhāṣanta
translated: Then the Four Great Kings addressed the Blessed One in verse:

original: aho suramyaṃ varasūtraratnaṃ prakāśitam īdṛśa paścakāle /
analyzed: aho su ramyam vara sūtra ratnam prakāśitam paśca kāle
translated: Ah, this beautiful jewel of a supreme sūtra has been revealed in this way in the latter time.

original: sūtraratnaṃ prakāśitaṃ paśyati paścakāle //
analyzed: sūtra ratnam prakāśitam paśyati paśca kāle
translated: One sees this jewel of a sūtra revealed in the latter time.

original: sugatāna vai lokavināyakānāṃ ahaṃ hi dhāriṣyam sūtraratnam /
analyzed: vai loka vināyakānām aham hi dhāriṣyam sūtra ratnam
translated: I will uphold this jewel of a sūtra of the Sugatas, the leaders of the world.

original: rakṣāṃ kariṣyāmyaha sūtraratnaṃ imavocadbhagavānāttamanā //
analyzed: rakṣām kariṣyāmi aha sūtra ratnam
translated: I will protect this jewel of a sutra. Thus spoke the Blessed One, with a delighted mind.

original: sā ca sarvāvatī parṣadbhagavato bhāṣitamabhyanandat /
analyzed: sā ca sarvāvatī parṣad bhagavataḥ bhāṣitam abhyanandat
translated: And the entire assembly rejoiced in the Blessed One's words.

original: ajitasenavyakaraṇanirdeśo nāma mahāyānasūtraṃ samāptam //
analyzed: ajitasenavyakaraṇanirdeśaḥ nāma mahāyāna sūtram samāptam
translated: The Mahāyāna sūtra called The Teaching of the Discourse of Ajita's Army is complete.

original: deyadharmoyaṃ bālosiṃhena sārdha bhāryājājatitrana sārdhaṃ mātāpitroḥ paramaduṣkartroḥ sārdhaṃ kṣīṇīena akhiloṭiena diśoṭajāja maṅgali / / / / / / /
analyzed: deya dharmaḥ yam sārdham sārdham mātā pitroḥ parama duṣkartroḥ sārdham
translated: This is the gift of the Dharma, together with Bāloṣiṃha, his wife Jājatitrī, his parents who are extremely difficult to repay, with Kṣīṇī, Akhilaṭī, Diśoṭajā, Maṅgalī,

original: utrayannagarvidoṭiena vaṭrarikhuśoṭikhūśogoṭiena sārdhaṃ sarvasattvaiḥ sarva / / / / / / bhiryatra puṇya tadbha / / / / / /
analyzed: sārdham sarva sattvaiḥ sārva bhiḥ
translated: Uttrayanagardī, Viṭra, Rihu, Śoṭi, Khuśo, Goṭi, together with all beings, with all... wherever there is merit, that...

original: sarvasattvānāmanuttaraḥ / / / / / / sārdhaṃ paramakalyāṇamitrasthirabandhuena /
analyzed: sarva sattvānām anuttaraḥ sārdham parama kalyāṇa mitra sthira bandhuena
translated: The unsurpassed... of all beings, together with the supremely virtuous friend Sthirabhadra.

original: lisvitamidaṃ pustakaṃ dharmabhāṇakanarendradattena /
analyzed: lisvitam idam pustakam dharma bhāṇaka narendradattena
translated: This book was given by the Dharma preacher Narendradatta.
